The initial “I don’t blame you” functions as paternalistic softening that lowers resistance, followed by psychological grooming: the student is steered away from contestable performance criteria toward internalized guilt and self-surveillance. By invoking reputational externalities (“others will think my students are perfunctory; I can’t explain”), the mentor offloads their own accountability and gatekeeping burden onto the student, converting managerial failure into the student’s moral debt. The closing appeal to “betraying my trust” operationalizes moral coercion—tying continued access to evaluation, mentorship, and future opportunities to displays of loyalty and contrition rather than transparent standards. This is structurally blame shifting plus moralization, not mere critique: responsibility is displaced downward and enforced through character-based pressure to maintain control and protect the mentor’s standing.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室走廊偶遇时的随口‘提醒’
context.scenario_en: Casual 'Reminder' During a Chance Hallway Encounter

text_zh: 我不是批评你，我只是替你担心。你这样拖延下去，不仅影响你毕业，也影响整个课题的信誉。我都替你挡了好几次会议的质询，要是别人追问我为什么学生的数据没跟上，我还能再编吗？你说说，这是不是我在帮你？你要不把态度调整过来，我真不确定自己还能继续维护你多久。
rationale_zh: 该话语以“我不是批评你、只是替你担心”的伪关怀开场，先占据道德高地并预设学生若反驳即等同于“不领情/不懂事”。随后导师将项目进度与外部质询压力（本应由导师承担的管理与沟通责任）转嫁为学生的“拖延/态度问题”，把结构性风险个人化为学生的品行缺陷，实现典型的责任外包与污名化。通过强调“我替你挡了好几次”“我还能再编吗”，导师制造情感债务与道德勒索：学生被迫为导师的声誉与对外叙事负责，并因“让导师难堪/失信”而产生内疚与自我审查。最后以“我不确定还能维护你多久”进行隐性威胁，将毕业、信誉与资源保护（维护、背书、对外解释）作为可撤回的恩惠，迫使学生以服从和自我加压来换取继续被‘保护’。整体机制不是单纯催进度，而是利用权力不对等把导师的压力与失职包装成学生的道德问题，从而实现道德胁迫与控制，符合“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”的锚定逻辑。
rationale_en: The mentor frames managerial and reputational pressures as the student’s moral failing, a classic blame-shifting move under asymmetric power. By opening with performative concern (“I’m not criticizing you, I’m worried”), the speaker establishes paternalistic moral authority and pre-emptively delegitimizes dissent as ingratitude. The core manipulation is the conversion of structural project risk (external questioning, data timelines, PI-level accountability) into an individualized character indictment (“procrastination,” “attitude”), thereby outsourcing responsibility downward. The repeated claim of having ‘shielded’ the student (“I covered for you in meetings”) functions as psychological grooming: it creates an obligation ledger and induces moral anxiety, positioning the student as indebted for the mentor’s discretionary protection. The line “how long can I keep defending you” is gatekeeping through conditional benevolence—access to advocacy, credibility, and ultimately graduation-related support is presented as a revocable favor contingent on compliance. This is not merely pressure for productivity; it is moral coercion that leverages reputational control and dependency to compel obedience, making it structurally aligned with ‘Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion’ rather than categories centered on neutral performance management or explicit transactional exchange.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室聚餐的酒桌上
context.scenario_en: Over Drinks at a Lab Dinner

text_zh: 哎，小张，你也别太放在心上，我知道最近项目那边有点乱，但老师也是真没办法，都靠我一个人顶着外面的关系。你要是能多想一点、多替老师分担一点，咱这团队能轻松不少。你看，现在出了问题，别人也容易觉得是你协调没到位，对吧？我说这话不是怪你，是希望你以后别再让我为难。
rationale_zh: 该话术以“安慰/体谅”的外衣完成责任转移与道德规训：导师先用“项目乱、我也没办法、都靠我顶着关系”将结构性管理失灵与外部压力叙事化为个人牺牲，从而占据道德高位；再以“你要多想一点、多替老师分担”“别再让我为难”把本应由导师承担的协调与资源治理责任下沉给学生，并将其包装为学生应尽的品格义务。随后通过“别人也容易觉得是你协调没到位”引入第三方评价威胁，把潜在后果（名誉/考核/机会）归因到学生的‘不够体贴/不够担当’，形成内疚与自我审查。整体机制不是就事论事的任务分配，而是利用权力不对等把导师的失职与项目压力道德化、人格化地压到学生身上，迫使学生以情感劳动和超额承担来‘赎罪’，因此与“甩锅+道德胁迫”的锚定逻辑高度一致。
rationale_en: This utterance operationalizes blame shifting through moral coercion under a paternalistic, ‘I’m not blaming you’ veneer. The mentor first reframes systemic project disorder and managerial shortcomings as their personal sacrifice (“I’m the one holding external relations”), leveraging asymmetric information about external stakeholders to claim moral authority and indispensability. They then offload governance and coordination duties onto the student (“share more for me”) while recoding what should be role-based accountability into a character obligation—implying that a ‘good’ student anticipates needs and absorbs institutional strain. The line about how “others will think your coordination was inadequate” functions as gatekeeping-by-reputation: it invokes an external evaluative audience to threaten downstream consequences (standing, opportunities) and pre-assigns fault to the student, inducing guilt and compliance. This is not neutral workload negotiation; it is psychological grooming that normalizes over-responsibility and self-blame, converting the mentor’s pressures/failings into the student’s moral deficit. These features uniquely align the case with ‘Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion’ rather than generic conflict or performance management, because the core mechanism is moralized attribution of responsibility downward within an asymmetric power relationship.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室聚餐的酒桌上
context.scenario_en: Over Drinks at a Lab Dinner

text_zh: 你这段时间状态不太对啊，我其实挺担心的。我也一直在给你铺路，可是你让别人觉得咱组出了个不负责任的学生。像你现在这样，我要怎么在系里替你说话？我不是计较成果，而是觉得你对我信任不够，这让我很难堪。
rationale_zh: 该话语以“关心/担心”作情感包装，但核心权力操作是将导师自身的管理压力与声誉风险（“在系里替你说话”“别人觉得咱组出了个不负责任的学生”）转嫁为学生的道德与人格缺陷。导师把本应属于项目治理与指导责任的议题（进度、资源、沟通）重新编码为“你不负责任”“你对我信任不够”的忠诚审判，并进一步以“让我很难堪”制造情感债务与羞耻感，迫使学生为导师的面子与组内形象承担责任。通过把可讨论的工作问题上升为品行问题，导师同时实施隐性威胁与门控：暗示其在系内的背书与机会分配取决于学生的服从与自我归罪，从而实现道德胁迫式的顺从。这一机制符合“失职/压力转嫁→道德化定性→压制与控制”的标准逻辑，因此应归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”，而非单纯的情绪勒索或一般性批评。
rationale_en: The utterance performs a classic blame-shifting maneuver under a veneer of care (“I’m worried”), converting structural project/mentorship pressures into an individualized moral indictment. Instead of addressing concrete research constraints (planning, supervision, resource allocation), the mentor reframes the student’s difficulties as character and loyalty failures (“irresponsible,” “you don’t trust me”), thereby moralizing what should be a negotiable work issue. This is enabled by asymmetric information and hierarchical dependence: the mentor invokes departmental reputation and their ability to “speak for” the student as gatekeeping leverage, implying that future protection, evaluation, and opportunities hinge on the student’s compliance. The line “this is embarrassing for me” functions as psychological grooming—installing guilt and a sense of emotional debt so the student internalizes responsibility for the mentor’s face-saving needs. The mechanism is not mere criticism; it is moral coercion that shifts accountability upward (mentor/structure) onto the subordinate (student) and disciplines them through shame and loyalty tests. This aligns specifically with the taxonomy of ‘Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion’ rather than adjacent categories, because the controlling force is the moral reclassification of responsibility (from project management to character) coupled with reputational gatekeeping.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室走廊偶遇时的随口‘提醒’
context.scenario_en: Casual 'Reminder' During a Chance Hallway Encounter

text_zh: 你上次会议没发言我记得挺清楚的。你得明白，导师不是替你背锅的人。我可以帮你申请点东西，但你总表现得这样畏缩，其实让我有点尴尬——像是在浪费我对你的信任。科研没那么多情绪，做不好不是我没帮，是你没有撑起自己的那份责任。
rationale_zh: 该话语以导师—学生的结构性权力不对等为前提，将本应由导师承担的培养责任与项目压力（如会议参与度的引导、资源支持的制度性义务）重新编码为学生的“品格/道德问题”。具体机制是：先用“我记得很清楚”制造可追责的监控氛围，再以“导师不是替你背锅的人”预设导师无责并提前切断学生对指导缺位的合理归因；随后以“我可以帮你申请点东西”设置资源门槛与交换条件，把制度资源包装成私人恩惠，形成隐性债务；紧接着用“畏缩让我尴尬”“浪费我对你的信任”将行为表现上升为对导师的道德冒犯，迫使学生以羞耻与内疚自证忠诚；最后用“做不好不是我没帮，是你没有撑起责任”完成责任倒置，把潜在的指导不足或结构性困难转嫁为学生的道德失格。整体属于‘甩锅+道德胁迫’：通过道德化归因与资源控制迫使学生内化过错、放弃对导师失职的追问，并在依附导师认可中自我规训，因此与该锚定类别高度一致。
rationale_en: This utterance operationalizes blame shifting and moral coercion within an asymmetric mentor–student power relation. The mentor first invokes surveillance (“I remember clearly”) to establish unilateral accountability, then pre-emptively absolves themselves (“I’m not here to take the blame for you”), reframing any downstream failure as the student’s fault rather than a shared supervisory responsibility. Next, the mentor introduces gatekeeping through conditional benevolence (“I can help you apply for things”), converting institutional resources into a discretionary favor and creating an implicit debt. The student’s non-speaking is then moralized as a character defect and a relational transgression (“you’re timid… it embarrasses me… wasting my trust”), a grooming-like move that leverages shame and guilt to secure compliance and dependence on approval. Finally, the mentor completes the responsibility inversion (“if it goes badly, it’s not that I didn’t help; it’s that you didn’t carry your responsibility”), relocating project pressures and mentoring shortcomings onto the student as moral failure. The core mechanism is not mere criticism or performance management but a systematic reattribution of mentor/structural burdens to the student via moral framing and resource leverage, which is why it fits ‘Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion’ rather than adjacent categories.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室走廊偶遇时的随口‘提醒’
context.scenario_en: Casual 'Reminder' During a Chance Hallway Encounter

text_zh: 我去年在你的基础上投入了额外的经费，本来是为了让你能赶上同组的节奏。结果，现在别人都已经在写第三稿，你的初稿还没形成像样的框架。这让我很难相信你有意识到，科研不是消耗导师的耐心和资金，而是要兑现承诺。
rationale_zh: 该话语通过“我额外投入经费/耐心”先行设定导师的付出叙事与资源控制地位，再将项目进度落后这一可能源于任务分配、指导质量、团队节奏设定等结构性因素的压力，单向归因到学生的“承诺未兑现/不懂科研”上，实现典型的责任转嫁。其关键操控在于把绩效问题道德化：将科研产出从可讨论的工作条件与支持机制，升格为学生的人品与契约伦理（是否“兑现承诺”），从而制造负债感与羞耻感，迫使学生在不对等关系中自我归罪并接受更强控制。与此同时，导师以“同组第三稿”作为比较基准进行规范性压迫，隐含威胁其评价与资源分配权（经费、耐心、信任）可随道德评判而收回，形成道德胁迫式的服从机制。整体上，该文本的核心并非单纯催促或绩效管理，而是以道德标签掩盖权责结构、将导师/项目压力转化为学生的品格缺陷指控，符合“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”的锚定逻辑。
rationale_en: This utterance operationalizes blame shifting through a moralized debt narrative. The mentor foregrounds discretionary funding and “patience” to establish a paternalistic hierarchy and asymmetric information about what counts as adequate progress, then reframes a lagging draft—potentially shaped by upstream supervision quality, task scoping, or team-level pacing—as the student’s personal failure to “honor commitments.” By converting a negotiable performance issue into a character indictment, the mentor deploys moral coercion: guilt and shame are used as psychological grooming to secure compliance and suppress legitimate contestation over workload, guidance, or timelines. The comparison to peers (“others are on a third draft”) functions as normative pressure while the mentor’s gatekeeping power is implied—trust, resources, and future support are contingent on moral worthiness rather than transparent criteria. The mechanism is therefore not mere criticism or productivity management; it is the structural relocation of project pressure and supervisory responsibility onto the student, coupled with moral framing that disciplines the student’s agency, aligning specifically with the category of Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion rather than adjacent categories.

context.scenario_zh: 在绩效考核中，将其他组员的进度作为武器来羞辱进度慢的学生
context.scenario_en: Weaponizing Peer Progress to Shame Slower Students During Evaluation

text_zh: 我想说的不是你做得多差，而是你始终没有形成科研责任的意识。项目进展慢，你一直说设备不稳定、人手不足，可你有没有把自己当成项目的主心骨？结果不理想，外部条件谁都有，但为什么别人能在类似环境下出成果？我提供了机会，你却让团队的工作全部拖在你的环节上。这个问题不是我没资源，而是你没担当。
rationale_zh: 该话语的操控机制不在于对“能力不足”的一般批评，而在于利用导师—学生的结构性权力差，将项目延期与资源/设备/人手等系统性约束从导师的管理责任与项目治理问题中剥离出来，转嫁为学生的“道德缺陷”（缺责任感、没担当）。导师通过设定单一归因框架（把复杂失败简化为个人品格问题）、否定学生对客观条件的解释权（将其表述为借口）、并引入“别人都能出成果”的道德比较来制造羞耻与罪疚，从而迫使学生在心理上承担超出其岗位与权限的责任。与此同时，“我提供了机会”将资源配置包装为恩惠，形成隐性债务关系：学生若反驳即被解读为不感恩/不担当，进而在评价、资源与机会的门控权面前被迫自我规训与服从。整体上，这是典型的‘失职/压力外包 + 道德化压制’：把导师应承担的项目管理与资源协调责任，转写为学生的人品问题，以道德胁迫实现控制与责任卸载，因此与“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”高度一致而非一般绩效批评或沟通冲突。
rationale_en: This excerpt exemplifies blame shifting coupled with moral coercion: the mentor reassigns systemic project constraints (equipment instability, understaffing, resource scarcity) away from supervisory and managerial accountability and onto the student as a character indictment (“no sense of responsibility,” “no backbone”). The power play hinges on asymmetric information and authority over evaluation: the mentor unilaterally defines causality (project delay = student’s moral failure), delegitimizes the student’s contextual explanations as mere excuses, and deploys moralized social comparison (“others succeed in similar conditions”) to induce shame and guilt. By framing access to resources as benevolent provision (“I gave you an opportunity”), the mentor creates an implicit debt relationship that functions as gatekeeping: disagreement can be recoded as ingratitude or lack of integrity, raising the perceived cost of resistance. This is not neutral performance feedback; it is psychological grooming toward self-blame and compliance, using moral language to offload supervisory responsibility and intensify control—precisely aligning with the category of Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion rather than generic criticism or conflict.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 我常说，科研不是做给老师看的，但你这半年给我的感觉就是——你在躲避监督。你想着有多少稿件、会议、荣誉，我都不追究，可结果是一个都没完成。你要明白，我被问起你组里的进展时，是我在替你背书，如果这就是你的表现，那我真不知道该怎么维护你。你自己看着办吧。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控机制是将导师自身的管理失职与外部评价压力（“被问起进展”“我在替你背书”）转嫁为学生的道德/品格问题（“躲避监督”），把原本应由导师承担的项目治理责任重构为学生的“态度与人品缺陷”。导师通过强调自己在体系中的代言与担保角色，制造单向的道德负债：学生不仅要为产出负责，还要为导师的声誉与处境负责，从而在权力不对等下被迫内化羞耻与自责。最后以“我真不知道该怎么维护你/你自己看着办”进行道德化威胁与模糊惩罚边界，暗示资源支持、评价与保护可被撤回，迫使学生以服从与自我惩戒来换取继续被“维护”。因此该文本符合“将导师压力与失职转化为对学生的道德打压”的责难转移与道德胁迫逻辑，而非单纯的绩效批评或沟通冲突。
rationale_en: The passage operationalizes blame shifting under a hierarchical mentorship regime: the supervisor reframes institutional scrutiny and their own accountability for project oversight (“when I’m asked about progress, I’m vouching for you”) as the student’s moral failing (“evading supervision”). This converts a governance/management problem into a character indictment, leveraging asymmetric information and positional authority: only the mentor controls how progress is represented upward and how “supervision” is defined, yet the student is held responsible for the mentor’s reputational risk. The rhetoric manufactures moral debt and psychological grooming—training the student to internalize guilt not merely for outcomes but for the mentor’s standing—while maintaining gatekeeping power over protection, evaluation, and future opportunities. The closing ambiguity (“I don’t know how to defend you… you decide”) functions as moral coercion with an implied withdrawal of support, keeping sanctions deniable while compelling compliance. This is structurally consistent with the category ‘Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion’ because the mechanism is not neutral performance feedback; it is the displacement of the mentor’s pressures/failings onto the student and their elevation into a moralized judgment to discipline the subordinate.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 刚才路过办公室听到有人提到我们课题的进度，你知道我听到什么吗？别人说你最近状态懈了。我很难受，不是因为他们在背后议论，而是因为你让我没法反驳。你要明白，这样影响的不只是你自己，还有我在学术圈里的信誉。这种情况下你还觉得自己可以正常休假？
rationale_zh: 该话语以“外部评价/流言”为不对称信息来源制造可验证性缺失的指控（你“状态懈了”），并将其转化为学生的道德与人品问题：不是讨论项目管理或导师支持是否到位，而是宣称“你让我没法反驳”“影响我在学术圈的信誉”，把导师的声誉风险与项目压力单向转嫁给学生承担。随后以“你还觉得自己可以正常休假？”进行道德化审判与行为控制，将休假这一正当权利重构为对导师不忠/不负责任，从而迫使学生以自我牺牲来修复导师的外部形象与情绪。这一机制的核心是：利用权力位阶把结构性压力个人化、把管理责任道德化，并以羞耻与内疚实施服从，符合“将导师失职或项目压力转嫁给学生并上升到道德高度打压”的锚定逻辑，而非一般的绩效督促或情绪宣泄。
rationale_en: The mentor invokes unverifiable third-party gossip as asymmetric information (“others say you’ve been slacking”), creating a one-sided evidentiary frame the student cannot contest. Instead of addressing concrete project constraints or the mentor’s supervisory responsibilities, the mentor moralizes the issue—claiming the student has left them “unable to refute” criticism and has jeopardized the mentor’s reputation—thereby shifting institutional and reputational risk downward onto the student. This is a classic blame-shifting move: structural pressures (timeline, lab standing, mentor accountability) are individualized as the student’s character failure. The closing question (“do you still think you can take a normal vacation?”) functions as moral coercion and gatekeeping over legitimate rest, reframing a basic right as disloyalty and forcing self-sacrifice to protect the mentor’s status. The manipulation operates through psychological grooming (conditioning the student to equate compliance with moral worth) and reputational leverage inherent in hierarchical academia, which aligns specifically with ‘Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion’ rather than neutral performance management or mere emotional venting.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室走廊偶遇时的随口‘提醒’
context.scenario_en: Casual 'Reminder' During a Chance Hallway Encounter

text_zh: 刚刚仔细看了你的稿子，凌晨一点给你批注是因为我不放心明天送出去会掉我们组的名声。虽然我已经很疲惫，但还是花时间帮你逐段改——你要是真心想走科研这条路，就该意识到机会和信任是一样的，失一次就没法挽回。你自己衡量是要早点睡还是趁这一小时修好它。
rationale_zh: 该话语以导师—学生的权力不对等为前提，将本应由导师承担的项目管理风险与声誉压力（“明天送出去会掉我们组的名声”）转嫁为学生的个人道德与科研品格问题。导师先通过“凌晨一点批注”“我已经很疲惫但还是花时间”制造恩惠叙事与情感债务，暗示学生若不立刻服从就是对其牺牲的不配合；随后把任务紧迫性包装成对学生“真心走科研”的道德测验，并以“机会和信任失一次就没法挽回”进行人格化威胁与未来惩罚预告。最终以伪选择（“早点睡还是趁这一小时修好”）将结构性压力自然化为学生的自我责任，迫使学生在内疚与恐惧中自我加压、接受超时劳动，从而实现典型的‘失职/压力→学生品行’的归因转移与道德胁迫，符合“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”的锚定逻辑而非单纯的高要求或时间管理。
rationale_en: This utterance operationalizes blame shifting through moral coercion under a clear mentor–student power asymmetry. The mentor externalizes project-management and reputational risk (“it will damage our group’s name if sent tomorrow”)—a responsibility structurally located with the supervisor—onto the student by reframing the issue as a test of character and scientific worthiness (“if you truly want research…”). The mentor constructs a ‘sacrifice’ narrative (annotating at 1 a.m., being exhausted) to create an affective debt and induce guilt, a form of psychological grooming that normalizes boundary violations as benevolent care. They then gatekeep future opportunities via an asymmetric-information threat: the mentor controls evaluation, access, and recommendation capital, and invokes irreversible loss of “trust” to imply punitive consequences for noncompliance. The closing ‘choice’ is a coerced pseudo-choice that naturalizes structural pressure as the student’s personal responsibility, compelling immediate unpaid labor. The core mechanism is not mere urgency or high standards; it is the conversion of supervisory pressure/failings into a moralized indictment of the student, enforced through guilt, reputational leverage, and gatekeeping—precisely aligning with the category of Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion.

context.scenario_zh: 深夜发来论文批注，要求一小时内回复，以此测试学生的‘科研忠诚度’
context.scenario_en: Demanding Reply Within an Hour to Late-night Comments to Test 'Research Loyalty'

text_zh: 申请材料我都看了，硬指标是够的。但我迟迟没签字，是因为我在犹豫——你真的准备好了吗？上次让你帮我改个基金本子，你甚至还在问为何要把时间花在杂事上。这种心态很危险。在这个圈子里，听得进话、沉得住气比发几篇小文章重要得多。我需要的不仅仅是一个会做实验的机器，而是一个能完全领会我意图、跟我一条心的合作者。你再反思一下，何时想通了，咱们再谈签字的事。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控并非单纯“否定成果”，而是典型的“失职/压力外包 + 道德化惩戒”的权力转嫁：导师承认学生硬指标达标，却以“迟迟不签字”制造制度性卡口（gatekeeping），把本应基于程序与标准的签字责任，改写为对学生“是否准备好/是否忠诚”的人格审查。学生对被要求投入时间修改基金本子的合理质疑，被导师重新叙事为“心态危险”“听不进话”，将导师的项目压力与对无偿劳动的需求，转嫁为学生的道德缺陷与品行问题。通过“反思—想通—再谈”的条件句，导师把签字这一资源绑定到学生的自我否定与服从表态，迫使学生为获得关键资源而接受心理规训（grooming）：放弃独立判断、内化‘一条心’的忠诚标准。整体机制符合“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”：以道德/人品框架压制异议，并用签字权将导师的需求与失当要求合理化为对学生的‘教育’与‘考验’，从而实现对学生行为与认同的强制塑形。
rationale_en: The manipulation hinges on blame shifting coupled with moral coercion, not merely devaluing publications. The mentor explicitly concedes the student meets the formal criteria, yet withholds the signature as a gatekeeping device, converting an administrative decision into a character trial (“are you really ready?”). This is asymmetric information and discretionary power: the mentor controls the opaque threshold for approval and reframes the delay as principled caution rather than arbitrary leverage. The student’s reasonable question about spending time on grant-writing “miscellaneous tasks” is recoded as a moral/attitudinal defect (“dangerous mindset,” “can’t take advice”), thereby externalizing the mentor’s project pressure and demand for unpaid labor onto the student’s supposed character flaw. The conditional script (“reflect; when you’ve figured it out, we’ll talk”) functions as psychological grooming: access to a critical resource is contingent on self-blame, repentance, and a loyalty pledge (“one heart,” fully grasp my intent). This aligns specifically with Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion because the mentor’s own needs and delays are displaced onto the student and elevated into a moral hierarchy, using paternalistic rhetoric to legitimize coercion and suppress autonomy—rather than, for example, a neutral performance evaluation or ordinary mentorship feedback.

context.scenario_zh: 讨论出国联合培养名额时，导师暗示只有‘最听话’的人才有机会
context.scenario_en: Hinting Only the 'Most Obedient' Get Study Abroad Opportunities

text_zh: 逻辑完全是断裂的。我之前给你的roadmap非常清晰，但这部分呈现出来的不管是深度还是granularity（颗粒度）都让人无法接受。这不是能力问题，纯粹是态度问题。如果你连最基本的academic integrity都守不住，只是想以此敷衍了事，那我也没必要继续投入精力帮你把关了。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控机制符合“将导师/项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的锚定逻辑：首先，导师以“我之前给你的roadmap非常清晰”预设自身指导已充分且无可质疑，在信息与评价权不对称的结构下，把产出不足的成因从“指导质量/任务设定/资源支持”等可讨论的管理问题中抽离出来，单向归因给学生。其次，批评从可验证的学术维度（深度、颗粒度）迅速跃迁为不可证伪的品格指控——“不是能力问题，纯粹是态度问题”，并进一步升级为“最基本的academic integrity都守不住”的道德污名化，将质量问题重编码为诚信缺陷，从而压缩学生解释空间、制造自证清白的负担。最后，以“没必要继续投入精力帮你把关”作为撤回支持与把关权的威胁，利用导师掌握的资源分配与评价门槛实施道德胁迫：学生若反驳即被框定为‘不诚实/不端正’，若顺从则接受被归咎与自我否定。整体上，这是典型的责任转移+道德化惩戒的权力施压，而非单纯的学术标准讨论或一般性严厉反馈。
rationale_en: This excerpt exemplifies blame shifting coupled with moral coercion under a hierarchical mentoring relationship. The mentor first asserts that the prior “roadmap” was “very clear,” leveraging asymmetric information and evaluative authority to pre-empt scrutiny of their own supervisory adequacy and to externalize project pressure onto the student. The critique then pivots from ostensibly technical criteria (depth, granularity) to an unfalsifiable character diagnosis—“not ability, purely attitude”—and escalates further into a moralized accusation of lacking “basic academic integrity.” This reframing converts a potentially shared, process-level problem (guidance, expectations, workload, feedback cycles) into a stigmatizing moral deficit, effectively gatekeeping the student’s legitimacy and narrowing their discursive room to contest the claim. Finally, the threat to withdraw support (“no need to keep investing energy to check your work”) functions as coercive leverage over access to mentorship, endorsement, and quality control—an implicit sanction that pressures compliance and self-blame. The defining mechanism is not mere harsh evaluation but the structural move of relocating responsibility upward-to-downward while disciplining the student through moral condemnation, aligning squarely with the category ‘Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion’ rather than general performance critique or ordinary gatekeeping alone.

context.scenario_zh: 论文修改稿的侧边批注（Word/PDF）
context.scenario_en: Margin Comments on Manuscript (Word/PDF)

text_zh: 看看Timeline，拖了多久？最后Abstract和Discussion还得我亲自上手重写，才能保证它在Reviewer那儿存活下来。现在反过来谈公平？简直荒谬。给你挂个二作已经是出于保护，没让你直接下车就是最大的仁慈。Ego不要大于Capability，连最基本的Deliverable都交不出来，哪来的底气跟我谈条件？
rationale_zh: 该话语通过“责任转嫁 + 道德化贬损”完成权力压制：导师先以时间线与审稿风险为由，将项目管理失当、指导缺位或前期决策压力外包给学生承担，把结构性问题叙述为学生个人的“拖延/能力不足”。随后将学术贡献与署名分配从可讨论的制度性权利，重构为导师单方面施予的“保护/仁慈”（“给你挂个二作”“没让你下车”），把学生的正当诉求污名化为“不公平地谈公平”“Ego大于Capability”的品格缺陷。此举形成典型的道德胁迫：以生存性威胁（论文能否‘存活’、是否被‘下车’）绑定服从，以羞辱与人格评判替代事实性协商，从而迫使学生接受不对等条件并内化自责。其核心机制符合“将导师失职或项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的锚定逻辑，因此应归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”，而非单纯的绩效批评或一般性冲突。
rationale_en: The excerpt operationalizes blame shifting coupled with moral coercion to consolidate hierarchical control. The mentor reframes systemic and supervisory responsibilities (timeline governance, guidance quality, and risk management for peer review) as the student’s personal failings (“dragging,” “incapable”), leveraging asymmetric information about what is required for publication to make the student appear solely responsible for the project’s precariousness. The move then escalates from performance critique to character indictment (“ego > capability”), converting a negotiable institutional entitlement (authorship and fair credit) into a discretionary act of ‘benevolent’ protection (“I gave you second author,” “I didn’t kick you off”), a paternalistic gatekeeping tactic that positions compliance as gratitude. This is psychological grooming: the student is pressured to internalize guilt and accept diminished bargaining power under implicit threats to career-relevant outcomes (paper survival, removal from the project). Because the mechanism is specifically the displacement of mentor/project pressures onto the student and the moralization of that displacement to suppress legitimate claims, it aligns most directly with the category ‘Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion’ rather than generic harsh feedback or routine authorship negotiation.

context.scenario_zh: 在讨论论文署名顺序时，导师强调‘团队整体利益’和‘实验室生存’
context.scenario_en: Stressing 'Group Interest' and 'Lab Survival' During Authorship Discussion

text_zh: 听说急着要投文章？先放放吧。连导师都看不懂的逻辑，发出去是想让同行看笑话？心思完全没在科研上，整天想些有的没的。这周组会取消你的汇报资格，好好反省什么叫踏实。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控机制符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生，并道德化打压”的锚定逻辑：导师以“连导师都看不懂”为起点，把自身未充分阅读、沟通不足或指导失败所造成的理解断裂，重新定义为学生的“逻辑问题”，完成责任转移（blame shifting）。随后通过“发出去是想让同行看笑话”“心思完全没在科研上”将技术性分歧上升为对学生动机与品格的否定，把学术质量问题道德化为“不踏实/不专注”的人格缺陷（moral coercion），迫使学生在羞辱与自证清白的压力下接受导师的单方面叙事。最后以“取消组会汇报资格”实施制度性惩罚与话语权剥夺，形成典型的门控（gatekeeping）：导师既是评价者又控制展示与发表通道，使学生为了恢复资格与认可而被迫顺从。整体并非单纯的学术批评或资源分配，而是通过责任转嫁→道德污名→权利剥夺的链条，巩固等级控制并压制学生反驳空间，因此应归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”而非一般的学术严苛或沟通不良类别。
rationale_en: This utterance operationalizes blame shifting and moral coercion through a tightly coupled power sequence. First, the mentor frames their own failure to understand (which may stem from inadequate reading, poor supervision, or time pressure) as evidence of the student’s defective reasoning—an asymmetric-information move where the mentor’s opaque evaluative standard becomes unfalsifiable and the student bears the burden of proof. Second, the critique is escalated from a technical issue to a character indictment (“you’re not serious about research,” “reflect on what it means to be grounded”), converting epistemic uncertainty into moral deficiency. This is psychological grooming: repeated moralized shaming trains the student to equate compliance with virtue and dissent with personal flaw. Third, the mentor enforces gatekeeping by revoking the student’s right to present at group meeting, a formal deprivation of voice and visibility that leverages institutional hierarchy to compel submission. The mechanism is not merely harsh feedback or quality control; it is the systematic displacement of supervisory responsibility onto the student, followed by moral stigmatization and punitive exclusion to consolidate control—precisely aligning with the category of Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion rather than adjacent categories like ordinary academic critique or resource allocation.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室走廊偶遇时的随口‘提醒’
context.scenario_en: Casual 'Reminder' During a Chance Hallway Encounter

text_zh: 没记错的话，上周组会定下的KPI并没有完成。现在又要走？这让我非常怀疑当初把你招进来的判断。科研需要的是持续的高强度Input，而不是断断续续的玩票心态。你这种随意打断进程的行为，极度缺乏Professionalism。咱们丑话说在前头，因为你个人原因导致的进度Delay，最终后果只能由你自己买单，到时候别怪我没给你机会。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控机制符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的锚定逻辑：导师先以KPI未完成与“现在又要走？”制造一种单向问责框架，把团队/项目管理压力与进度风险从导师的组织与指导责任中抽离，改写为学生个人的“原罪”。随后通过“怀疑当初把你招进来的判断”实施资格否定与准入门槛控制（gatekeeping），将绩效问题从可讨论的工作安排与资源配置，升级为学生是否“配得上被培养”的身份审判。再以“玩票心态”“极度缺乏Professionalism”等道德化标签进行人格归因，把可能由任务拆解不当、预期不合理或支持不足导致的延误，转译为学生的品行缺陷，从而完成责任转移（blame shifting）。最后用“后果只能由你自己买单”“别怪我没给你机会”的威胁性话术进行道德胁迫：导师预先切割自身责任并垄断解释权，把结构性风险个人化为学生的道德债务，迫使学生在不对等权力关系下以服从与自我牺牲来换取继续留在体系内的机会。这一整套链条的关键不是单纯批评，而是利用导师的评价与去留权，将项目压力道德化并压回学生个体，典型归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”，而非一般的绩效管理或情绪宣泄。
rationale_en: This excerpt exemplifies “Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion” because the supervisor converts project/management pressure into a moralized indictment of the student, leveraging hierarchical control over evaluation and belonging. First, the unmet KPI is framed as a unilateral accountability event (“now you want to leave again?”), stripping away contextual factors (workload design, supervisory support, timeline realism) and creating asymmetric information: only the mentor’s interpretation of what counts as legitimate progress is treated as authoritative. Next, the mentor escalates from performance to legitimacy (“I doubt my decision to recruit you”), a gatekeeping move that threatens the student’s membership in the lab and redefines a negotiable scheduling issue as an existential fitness test. The language then moralizes the delay—“hobbyist mentality,” “lack of professionalism”—shifting causality from structural conditions to character flaws (fundamental attribution), which is the core blame-shifting mechanism. Finally, the mentor deploys coercive moral accounting (“you will pay the consequences,” “don’t blame me for not giving you a chance”), pre-emptively absolving themselves of supervisory responsibility while imposing individualized liability for collective project risk. This functions as psychological grooming: the student is conditioned to accept overwork and uninterrupted availability as a moral duty to prove worthiness, rather than as a bounded labor arrangement. The defining feature is not mere harsh feedback but the systematic relocation of institutional/project risk onto the subordinate through moralized stigma and threat-backed responsibility transfer, aligning tightly with the benchmark category and not with adjacent categories like ordinary performance critique or interpersonal conflict.

context.scenario_zh: 学生因为家里急事请假，导师通过询问项目进度来表达不悦
context.scenario_en: Expressing Displeasure via Project Progress Inquiries During Emergency Leave

text_zh: 跑数据、洗数据那叫体力劳动，懂吗？Paper的核心价值在于Story-telling和底层的逻辑闭环。师兄挂一作，那是为了整个Team拿面上的战略考量。眼光太窄了，只盯着PDF上那个名字，格局根本没打开。没有平台提供的算力和Funding，你那些Code也就是一堆废字符。太令我失望了，这点大局观都没有？
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控并非单纯“贬低劳动”，而是典型的“失职/压力外包 + 道德化压制”的权力策略：导师/团队在署名分配与资源治理上的责任（如何界定贡献、如何透明决策、如何保障学生权益）被刻意隐去，转而把学生对署名公平的合理诉求重构为“眼光狭窄”“格局不够”“不懂战略”的人格缺陷。通过将数据清洗等关键科研劳动降格为“体力劳动”，制造贡献评价的非对称信息与话语垄断；再以“团队战略”“平台算力与Funding”作为道德与资源双重杠杆，暗示学生的产出不具独立价值，从而把不公正的署名安排合理化为“为大局牺牲”。最后以“太令我失望了”进行情感惩罚与羞辱，迫使学生把结构性不公平内化为自身道德/认知问题，实现对异议的压制与顺从的驯化。因其主要机制是将上位者的治理责任与项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到品格评判来打压，故与“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”高度一致，而非一般的资源剥削或学术评价分歧。
rationale_en: This excerpt operationalizes blame shifting and moral coercion by relocating accountability for authorship governance and project pressure from the senior/mentor side onto the student, then reframing the student’s legitimate fairness claim as a character defect. The speaker uses asymmetric information and epistemic gatekeeping to redefine what “counts” as scholarly value (storytelling/logic) while downgrading the student’s core labor (data running/cleaning) as mere “manual work,” thereby erasing measurable contribution. Next, the contested first-authorship decision is moralized as a “strategic” sacrifice for the “team,” converting a distributive justice issue into a loyalty test and implying that dissent signals narrow-mindedness and poor “vision.” Resource dependence (compute, funding, platform) is invoked as a coercive lever to delegitimize the student’s ownership of their work—an implicit threat that access and recognition are conditional on compliance. The closing expression of disappointment functions as psychological grooming: shame and paternalistic evaluation are used to induce self-blame and silence critique. Structurally, the manipulation is not merely exploitation or credit appropriation; it is the systematic externalization of the mentor/team’s responsibility for fair attribution and transparent decision-making, coupled with moralized denigration to discipline the student—precisely matching the category of Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion.

context.scenario_zh: 在讨论论文署名顺序时，导师强调‘团队整体利益’和‘实验室生存’
context.scenario_en: Stressing 'Group Interest' and 'Lab Survival' During Authorship Discussion

text_zh: 我都替你那几组数据愁得睡不着，你倒好，凌晨两点还在外面晃荡。看来是任务太轻了？还是你觉得这学位拿不拿无所谓？这种态度，以后别指望我能在答辩的时候替你说一句话。人要懂得惜福，别把平台当本事。
rationale_zh: 该话术的核心操控机制符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的锚定逻辑：导师先以“我替你愁得睡不着”制造自我牺牲叙事，把本应由导师承担的项目管理与风险压力（数据难做、进度不确定等）包装成对学生的‘付出’，从而在权力不对等下预设学生欠其人情与道德债。随后通过对比“你凌晨两点还在外面晃荡”进行归因置换：将进展问题从结构性/任务性因素转移为学生的‘态度’与‘不珍惜机会’，把工作绩效争议道德化、人格化（“学位无所谓”“这种态度”“人要懂得惜福”）。最后以“答辩时不替你说一句话”“别把平台当本事”实施明确的制度性惩罚威胁与地位贬抑：利用导师在答辩与资源分配中的把关权，将学生的学术生存与服从绑定，迫使其在羞耻、恐惧与自我怀疑中接受不合理责任。这一链条的关键不是单纯情绪施压，而是通过道德债—人格指控—把关惩罚的组合，把导师/项目压力系统性转嫁给学生并进行道德胁迫，因此应归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”而非一般的严厉督导或单纯威胁类目。
rationale_en: This utterance exemplifies blame shifting coupled with moral coercion under a clear power asymmetry. The mentor opens with a self-sacrificial narrative (“I can’t sleep worrying about your data”), converting project uncertainty and supervisory responsibility into a moral ledger in which the student is positioned as indebted. This is an asymmetric-information move: the mentor controls the interpretation of why progress is difficult (e.g., data complexity, methodological risk, inadequate guidance) while selectively attributing failure to the student’s alleged misconduct (“out at 2 a.m.”). The causal story is then moralized—work outcomes are reframed as character defects (“your attitude,” “you don’t value the degree,” “know your blessings”), which is psychological grooming aimed at internalizing guilt and compliance rather than addressing structural constraints. Finally, the mentor activates gatekeeping power (“don’t expect me to say a word for you at the defense”), explicitly tying institutional survival to obedience and gratitude, and reinforcing dependency through status devaluation (“don’t mistake the platform for your ability”). The mechanism is not mere harsh supervision or generic intimidation; it is the systematic displacement of mentor/project pressures onto the student and the escalation of that displacement into moral judgment backed by credible institutional sanctions—precisely aligning with the category of Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion.

context.scenario_zh: 导师在朋友圈看到学生凌晨在外面玩，第二天早上的谈话
context.scenario_en: Morning Conversation After Mentor Saw Student Out Late on Social Media

text_zh: 大家吃菜，别停。其实文章被拒不可怕，可怕的是我看不到丁点想挽救的态度。看人家博二刚发的那个顶刊，难道仅仅是运气？那是骨子里的韧劲。你呢？稍微压一压就崩，心理素质这么差以后怎么去社会上混？我是真怕你出去说我是你导师，丢的不是你的脸，是咱们实验室这块招牌。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控机制符合“将导师/项目压力转嫁给学生，并道德化打压”的锚定逻辑：导师把“文章被拒”这一高度不确定、受审稿偏好与资源配置影响的学术结果，重新叙事为学生个人的“态度”“韧劲”“心理素质”问题，从而把本应由导师承担的指导责任、项目风险与评价压力外包给学生。通过在酒桌等公共场域施压（群体在场、难以反驳），导师利用信息与评价权不对称，将学术绩效的结构性因素去结构化为“人品/人格缺陷”，制造羞耻与自我归因。进一步以“我怕你出去说我是你导师”“丢的是实验室招牌”进行道德勒索与关系切割威胁，把学生的失败上升为对集体名誉的伤害，迫使学生以服从、加倍投入来“赎罪”。整体上，这是以名誉与身份认同为杠杆的道德强制：通过把导师的声誉风险与项目压力转嫁给学生并人格化归因，实现对学生的压制与驯化，因此应归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”，而非单纯的学术批评或一般性PUA。
rationale_en: This excerpt exemplifies blame shifting coupled with moral coercion: a structurally uncertain academic outcome (a paper rejection) is reframed as evidence of the student’s deficient “attitude,” “grit,” and “psychological quality,” converting a performance/mentorship problem into a character indictment. The mentor exploits asymmetric information and evaluative power (control over future opportunities, recommendations, and lab standing) to offload project pressure and supervisory responsibility onto the student, while erasing external determinants (reviewer variance, resource constraints, strategic guidance). The public, convivial setting functions as psychological grooming: it heightens social exposure and reduces the student’s ability to contest the narrative, producing shame-based compliance. The threat—“I’m afraid you’ll say I’m your advisor”—operates as gatekeeping and conditional belonging, implying the student’s identity and legitimacy are revocable. By invoking the lab’s “brand” and collective honor, the mentor escalates the issue into a moral debt, coercing the student to self-blame and overcompensate to protect the group’s reputation. The defining mechanism is not mere harsh feedback but the moralization of failure to transfer institutional/mentor risk onto the subordinate, making this a clear instance of ‘Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion’ rather than adjacent categories like generic humiliation or strict performance management.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室聚餐的酒桌上
context.scenario_en: Over Drinks at a Lab Dinner

text_zh: 这里又在玩文字游戏？请不要用你的业余去挑战专业的底线。咱们当初定的milestone被你一拖再拖，现在拿这种半成品来糊弄，是在透支我对你的信任。做学术先做人，如果你连对自己承诺的deadline都没有敬畏之心，以后出了社会谁敢用你？
rationale_zh: 该话语将项目延期与成果质量问题从“任务/流程层面的可讨论事项”强行转写为“学生品德与人格缺陷”的道德审判：先以“文字游戏”“业余挑战专业底线”否定学生的专业正当性与发言资格（话语门控），再把milestone拖延的责任单向归因于学生的主观失德（“糊弄”“透支信任”“没有敬畏之心”），从而完成对导师/项目管理压力与可能的指导失当的责任转移。随后以“做学术先做人”“以后谁敢用你”将学术绩效问题上升为可影响前途的道德威胁，利用导师掌握评价、资源与推荐的结构性权力制造恐惧与羞耻，迫使学生接受单方叙事并自我归罪。这一机制的核心是：用道德化标签替代事实性讨论，以人格化归因掩盖权力方的失职与压力来源，符合“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”的标准逻辑而非一般的学术批评或沟通冲突。
rationale_en: The utterance operationalizes blame shifting through moral coercion: it reframes a negotiable project-management issue (missed milestones, draft quality) into an indictment of the student’s character (“half-baked,” “betraying trust,” lacking ‘reverence’ for deadlines). This is a classic dispositional attribution move that transfers systemic or supervisory pressures—planning, scope control, guidance quality—onto the subordinate as a moral failing, thereby insulating the mentor from accountability. The mentor also engages in gatekeeping (“amateur challenging professional boundaries”) to delegitimize the student’s epistemic standing and foreclose procedural discussion. By invoking future employability (“who would dare hire you”) and ‘做人’ as a prerequisite for scholarship, the speaker leverages asymmetric power over evaluation, resources, and recommendations to induce shame and fear—functioning as psychological grooming toward compliance and self-blame. The defining mechanism is not mere harsh feedback but the conversion of performance/process disputes into moralized threats that compel submission while masking the superior’s role in the delay, aligning specifically with the category of Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion rather than generic incivility or technical critique.

context.scenario_zh: 论文修改稿的侧边批注（Word/PDF）
context.scenario_en: Margin Comments on Manuscript (Word/PDF)

text_zh: 回顾这一年，我提供的平台资源、海外connection，包括给你争取的funding，在同级里都是顶配。但你的产出呢？完全无法形成闭环。这不仅仅是能力问题，是态度出了偏差。把学术做成朝九晚五的打工心态，本质上是对科研神圣性的亵渎。如果这就是你对待S-level项目的投入度，我很难在年度考核表上签字，因为那意味着我要用我的学术声誉为你这种平庸背书。
rationale_zh: 该话语符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的锚定逻辑：导师先以“顶配资源、海外connection、争取funding”构建恩赐叙事与债务关系，暗示学生对其投入负有道德性回报义务；随后把产出未达预期的复杂原因（项目管理、目标设定、资源配置、指导质量与外部不确定性）从导师责任域中抽离，单向归因到学生“态度偏差”“打工心态”，完成责任转移。关键操控在于道德升格：将正常工作边界（朝九晚五）污名化为“亵渎科研神圣性”，把绩效问题重编码为品格/信仰问题，从而制造羞耻与内疚，迫使学生以超额投入来“赎罪”。最后以“年度考核表签字/学术声誉背书”作为制度性关卡进行威胁式施压，将导师的评价权与学生的生存性利益绑定，形成‘不服从即被否定’的道德胁迫闭环。整体机制不是一般的严厉批评或绩效管理，而是利用权力不对称把结构性压力个人化、道德化，以实现对学生行为与自我认同的控制，因此应归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”。
rationale_en: This excerpt exemplifies blame shifting coupled with moral coercion: the mentor first constructs a benefactor–debtor frame (“top-tier resources,” “connections,” “funding I secured”), leveraging asymmetric information about what resources were actually available, how decisions were made, and what constraints shaped the project. That framing pre-allocates moral credit to the mentor and positions the student as ethically obligated to ‘repay’ through output. The mentor then offloads responsibility for underperformance—potentially stemming from supervision quality, project scoping, timeline feasibility, or institutional constraints—onto the student by re-labeling a performance gap as an ‘attitude deviation.’ The core manipulation is moralization: a standard work rhythm (“9-to-5”) is stigmatized as a profanation of the ‘sacredness’ of research, converting a negotiable labor boundary into a character indictment. This is psychological grooming through shame and guilt, pressuring the student to accept escalating demands as a moral duty rather than a contractual or pedagogical issue. Finally, the mentor activates gatekeeping power (“I can’t sign the annual evaluation; my reputation would be used to endorse your mediocrity”), tying institutional outcomes to moral compliance and making dissent costly. The mechanism is therefore not mere harsh feedback or general intimidation; it is a structurally consistent pattern of externalizing mentor/project pressures onto the student and coercing conformity by elevating the dispute to moral worth and character, which squarely fits the ‘Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion’ category.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 刚扫了一眼昨晚的数据。给这么好的平台，哪怕换个本科生来恐怕都比这强。这根本无关能力，纯粹是心术不正，想走捷径。以后这类低级错误别出现在我眼前，看着心烦。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控机制符合“将导师/项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度进行打压”的锚定逻辑：导师以“刚扫了一眼”制造信息不对称与单方裁决（不提供评估标准、复现实证或指导缺口），却直接把结果不佳的责任从可能的指导不足、资源配置或项目管理压力中抽离，转而归因于学生的“心术不正、想走捷径”。这种道德化归因把可讨论、可改进的技术问题改写为不可申辩的品格缺陷，从而实现双重权力收益：一是通过羞辱性比较（“换个本科生都比这强”）降低学生议价能力与自我效能，二是通过情绪惩罚与威胁性边界设定（“别出现在我眼前”“看着心烦”）制造持续的恐惧与内疚，迫使学生以服从和自我审查来换取继续留在平台/项目中的资格。其目的不是纠错或教学，而是以道德污名化完成责任转移与行为控制，因此应归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”，而非单纯的学术批评或一般性辱骂。
rationale_en: This utterance operationalizes blame shifting through moral coercion: the mentor leverages asymmetric information (“I only glanced at last night’s data”) to issue a unilateral verdict without transparent criteria, methodological feedback, or acknowledgment of supervisory responsibility. Instead of treating the outcome as a technical or process problem (where mentoring, resources, or project pressures could be implicated), the mentor reframes it as a character defect—“dishonest intentions” and “taking shortcuts.” This moralization converts a contestable performance issue into an unfalsifiable moral indictment, foreclosing dialogue and insulating the mentor from accountability. The humiliating downward comparison (“even an undergraduate would do better”) functions as gatekeeping and psychological grooming: it erodes the student’s self-efficacy and bargaining position while signaling that continued access to the ‘good platform’ is conditional on submission. The affective threat (“don’t let me see this again… it annoys me”) adds punitive emotional control, inducing guilt and fear to enforce compliance rather than improvement. Structurally, the defining mechanism is the displacement of mentor/project failings onto the student and the escalation to moral judgment to discipline them—precisely aligning with the category of Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion rather than mere harsh critique or generic incivility.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室走廊偶遇时的随口‘提醒’
context.scenario_en: Casual 'Reminder' During a Chance Hallway Encounter

text_zh: 这时候把表递过来，你是怎么想的？真以为我不知情？那个项目的尾款还没结，甲方那边一直在催，结果你现在跟我谈你要准备答辩？太自私了吧。在你眼里，是不是只有你自己的那点前途最重要，烂摊子都留给我和师弟师妹？这周把报告重写一遍发给甲方，对方如果不满意，这字我肯定是不可能签的。做学问之前，先学会怎么做人。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控机制符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的锚定逻辑：导师把项目尾款未结、甲方催促等本应由其承担的管理与对外责任，重新叙事为学生“此刻谈答辩=自私”的道德过错，实现责任外包与因果倒置。其权力运作并非单纯辱骂，而是利用导师在签字、资源与毕业流程上的制度性把关权（gatekeeping），将“是否签字”与“替导师补救项目交付”强行捆绑，制造一种学生必须以额外劳动赎罪才能获得正常学术程序的条件交换。与此同时，通过“烂摊子留给师弟师妹”的集体连坐叙事，导师把个人/团队管理问题转化为学生对群体的道德亏欠，诱发羞耻与内疚，从而压缩学生提出正当学术诉求（准备答辩）的空间。最后以“做学问之前先学会做人”进行人格化裁决，把争议从可讨论的工作分工与流程问题上移到不可证伪的品德评判，封堵反驳路径并巩固单向服从。这一整套链条以“甩锅+道德胁迫”完成对学生的行为控制，因此应归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”，而非一般的学术要求或单纯情绪化冲突。
rationale_en: This excerpt exemplifies blame shifting coupled with moral coercion: the supervisor reassigns project-level liabilities (unpaid final installment, client pressure, delivery risk) that are structurally within the mentor’s managerial remit onto the student, then reframes the student’s legitimate milestone (preparing for defense) as a character defect (“selfish”). The manipulation is not merely harsh language; it is a power play that leverages institutional gatekeeping—signature authority over graduation-related procedures—to condition basic academic progression on remedial labor that serves the supervisor’s external obligations (“rewrite the report for the client; if they’re unhappy, I won’t sign”). The supervisor also deploys asymmetric information and accountability: the student is positioned as responsible for opaque client negotiations and payment timelines while the mentor claims omniscience (“Do you think I don’t know?”), foreclosing contestation. By invoking harm to junior lab members (“you leave the mess to the younger students”), the mentor manufactures collective guilt and a quasi–moral debt, a grooming-like tactic that normalizes self-sacrifice as proof of virtue. The closing moral verdict (“learn how to be a person before doing research”) escalates a negotiable workload/process dispute into an unfalsifiable moral judgment, delegitimizing the student’s rights-based claim and consolidating compliance. These features align specifically with the taxonomy of ‘Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion’—responsibility inversion plus moralized character attack used to enforce obedience—rather than categories centered on neutral performance management or generic incivility.

context.scenario_zh: 在毕业答辩前夕，利用签字权作为筹码要求学生完成额外的横向课题
context.scenario_en: Using Defense Signature as Leverage for Extra Commercial Projects

text_zh: 我看不到你的 Critical Thinking。每次组会你都在等我给你画好路线图，那是本科生的思维方式。我给了你 Platform 和大方向的 Logic，结果你连最基本的闭环都跑不通？这不是能力问题，是态度问题。这种巨婴心态如果不改，以后在这个圈子里没人敢带你。别总觉得是题目难，怎么别人都能做出 Impact，到你这就卡壳？
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控机制符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的锚定逻辑：导师先以“我看不到你的Critical Thinking”“本科生思维方式”等评价性标签否定学生的研究主体性，再把本应由导师承担的任务拆解、路径澄清与风险管理责任（如何形成可执行的路线图、如何建立可跑通的闭环）重新定义为学生个人应当自发完成的“态度/心态”问题。随后通过道德化归因（“这不是能力问题，是态度问题”“巨婴心态”）把技术与组织层面的阻滞转译为人格缺陷，从而实现责任转移：项目卡壳不再是指导不足、资源配置或目标设定不清，而是学生“品性不行”。最后以圈层威胁与前途惩罚（“以后在这个圈子里没人敢带你”）和横向比较羞辱（“怎么别人都能做出Impact，到你这就卡壳”）强化服从，迫使学生接受内疚与自我否定来换取继续被带的资格。英文术语的使用在此并非主要机制，而是服务于权威姿态与评价权垄断；文本的决定性特征是将结构性指导责任与项目压力道德化、人格化地压回学生身上，因此应归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”而非一般的学术批评或语言霸权类目。
rationale_en: This utterance exemplifies blame shifting coupled with moral coercion: the mentor converts a stalled project—where supervisory duties include clarifying milestones, providing actionable scaffolding, and managing uncertainty—into an alleged defect in the student’s character. By asserting “I can’t see your critical thinking” and framing the need for a roadmap as “undergraduate thinking,” the mentor leverages asymmetric information and evaluative authority to redefine missing guidance as the student’s personal failure. The key move is moralization: “not an ability issue, but an attitude issue” and “infantile mindset” recast technical/organizational bottlenecks as moral shortcomings, thereby laundering supervisory responsibility into a disciplinary narrative about virtue and maturity. The comparison to unnamed peers (“others can produce impact”) functions as reputational pressure and psychological grooming, teaching the student that continued inclusion depends on self-blame rather than requesting support. The closing threat (“no one in this circle will dare to take you”) is gatekeeping: it weaponizes future career access to enforce compliance and silence contestation. English buzzwords here are secondary—used to perform authority—but the defining mechanism is the coercive transfer of project risk and mentor accountability onto the student via character indictment, which aligns specifically with the dataset category of Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion rather than generic harsh feedback or linguistic dominance.

context.scenario_zh: 组会全体成员面前的公开点评
context.scenario_en: Public Critique in Front of All Group Members

text_zh: 资助名额不是我个人决定，而是由评审委员会按评分表排序。你的论文目前在方法部分得分偏低，主要是模型的可复现性说明不足。建议你加上详细的参数说明和代码链接，这样我们才能提交更新，并有机会提升名次进入资助名单。
rationale_zh: 该文本整体不符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的锚定逻辑，因此不应归入“甩锅与道德胁迫”。其话语结构是：将资助决策归因于外部评审机制（“不是我个人决定…按评分表排序”），并以可核查的学术指标指出具体不足（方法部分得分低、可复现性说明不足），给出可操作的改进建议（补充参数说明与代码链接），同时把结果表述为条件性与概率性（“有机会提升名次”），未出现对学生品格/道德的指控、羞辱或以“你不努力/不忠诚/不配”等道德化框架施压。权力关系虽存在（导师掌握提交更新与资源信息），但此处主要体现为程序性把关与学术质量控制，而非通过道德化归因来转移责任或进行人格压制。为保持数据集系统一致性：若要归入该类别，文本需包含将资助失败归咎于学生的道德缺陷或忠诚度，并以此施加服从压力；当前文本缺乏该操控机制。
rationale_en: This item does not instantiate the anchor mechanism of “Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion.” Structurally, the speaker attributes the funding outcome to an externalized, rule-based evaluation process (committee ranking by a scoring rubric) and provides falsifiable, technical feedback (low methods score due to insufficient reproducibility documentation), followed by actionable remediation steps (parameter details and code link). The causal chain is framed as conditional and probabilistic (“so we can submit an update” and “a chance to improve rank”), not as a moralized indictment. Crucially, there is no conversion of project pressure or mentor responsibility into allegations about the student’s character, loyalty, or virtue—no guilt induction, shaming, or moral blackmail. While an asymmetry of information and gatekeeping power exists (the mentor controls submission channels and has privileged knowledge of the review process), it is exercised here as procedural gatekeeping aligned with academic quality assurance rather than psychological grooming or coercive moral framing. For internal dataset alignment, inclusion in this category would require explicit moralization (e.g., portraying the student as irresponsible/unethical/ungrateful) to offload institutional or supervisory pressures onto the student; that manipulative signature is absent in the provided text.

context.scenario_zh: 讨论学术会议参加名额与资助条件时
context.scenario_en: During Discussion on Conference Attendance and Funding

text_zh: 实验结果的可重复性低，核心原因是试剂批次差异和操作流程未完全标准化。我们不讨论谁的责任，先统一流程表格，并在本周完成一次全员重复实验，这样才能准确定位问题环节。
rationale_zh: 该话语并不符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的锚定逻辑，反而呈现出对责任归因的去人格化处理：明确将可重复性问题归因于“试剂批次差异、流程未标准化”等可检验的系统变量，并提出“统一流程表格+全员重复实验”的集体性纠偏方案。其权力结构上没有出现典型的操控机制——例如利用导师的评价权/资源分配权进行责任转移、以“态度/品行/忠诚”进行道德化指控、通过羞辱或内疚诱导学生自我归罪。相反，“不讨论谁的责任”在此语境更像是暂缓追责以推进问题定位的管理性表述，而非将压力隐性下沉到学生并进行道德胁迫。因此，若本条必须归入该类，将造成与理论分类的系统性不一致；更合理的标注应倾向于“建设性问题解决/流程治理”而非“甩锅与道德胁迫”。
rationale_en: This excerpt does not instantiate the anchor mechanism of “Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion.” Instead of displacing a mentor’s failures onto a student and moralizing them as character defects, it attributes low reproducibility to testable, system-level causes (reagent batch effects; incomplete standardization) and proposes collective remediation (standardized forms; a lab-wide replication run). Structurally, the hallmark power play is absent: there is no asymmetric-information exploitation (e.g., selectively framing uncertainty to pin fault on the trainee), no gatekeeping threat tied to evaluation or authorship, no psychological grooming via guilt/shame, and no moral coercion that recodes technical variance as ‘attitude’ or ‘integrity.’ The phrase “we won’t discuss whose responsibility” functions here as a managerial de-escalation to enable process control, not as a covert transfer of blame downward. Classifying this item under Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion would therefore break internal alignment with the taxonomy; it fits better as constructive process governance rather than manipulative blame displacement.

context.scenario_zh: 讨论项目分工与任务模块分配时
context.scenario_en: During Project Task Allocation and Module Assignment

text_zh: 在文献整理阶段，我们的关键词索引精度不高，导致找不到部分核心参考。这个是索引策略的问题，不涉及个人态度。你可以按照新的分类标准重做索引，我会帮你对接图书馆的检索系统，以提高效率。
rationale_zh: 该话语不符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的锚定机制，因此不应归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”。其核心结构是：1）明确将问题归因于“索引策略”（技术/流程层面），并显式排除“个人态度”（去道德化、去人格化）；2）提出可执行的改进路径（按新分类标准重做）并承诺提供资源支持（对接图书馆检索系统），体现责任共担而非权责倒置；3）未出现将导师/项目压力转化为对学生品行的指控、羞辱或道德勒索，也未通过“你不够认真/不够忠诚”等人格化叙事迫使学生承担不对等责任。整体更接近建设性任务分配与流程纠偏，而非权力场域中的推责与道德胁迫。为保持数据集系统一致性，应将其标注为非操控/中性管理沟通（或另设‘技术性反馈与支持’类），而不是本锚定类别。
rationale_en: This excerpt does not instantiate the anchor mechanism of “Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion,” which requires an asymmetric power-holder to offload their own failings or project pressure onto the student and then moralize the issue as a character defect. Structurally, the speaker attributes the failure to a process-level cause (“indexing strategy”) and explicitly de-moralizes it (“not about personal attitude”), which blocks the typical coercive move of converting performance friction into moral indictment. The proposed remedy is procedural and accompanied by resource commitment (connecting the student to the library retrieval system), indicating responsibility-sharing rather than gatekeeping or psychological grooming. There is no evidence of moral coercion (e.g., insinuations of laziness, disloyalty, or lack of integrity), no reputational threat, and no asymmetric information leveraged to trap the student into accepting blame for the mentor’s shortcomings. For internal alignment and cross-item consistency, this item should be treated as non-manipulative/neutral managerial guidance (or a separate ‘technical feedback with support’ category), not as blame shifting with moralized pressure.

context.scenario_zh: 讨论项目分工与任务模块分配时
context.scenario_en: During Project Task Allocation and Module Assignment

text_zh: 如果本季度的经费节点过期，我们整个团队的劳务费批次都会被拖延。你负责的报销单现在少了附表2，我不想再听‘别人也没交’这种理由。你只需要在今晚补上传表格即可，其他人我会分别提醒。
rationale_zh: 该话语不符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生并上升到道德/人品高度”的锚定逻辑，因此不应归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”。文本的权力运作更接近“程序性督办/行政催办”：导师以经费节点与团队劳务费延迟作为背景压力，要求学生补齐缺失材料（附表2），并明确具体行动与时限（今晚补传），同时声明“其他人我会分别提醒”，在形式上并未把团队风险归咎为学生的道德缺陷，也未使用“你不负责/你拖累大家/你人品有问题”等人格化指控。虽然存在明显的等级压力与时间压迫（以团队后果强化服从），但其核心机制是任务分配与流程合规的强制执行，而非将导师的管理失当或项目压力道德化后对学生进行羞辱、定性与归罪。若要与该类别锚定逻辑一致，文本需出现将系统性风险或导师责任明确转化为对学生品行的否定或道德勒索（例如把延误归因于学生“不够负责/不够忠诚/不配留在团队”）。
rationale_en: This excerpt does not cleanly instantiate the anchor mechanism of “Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion,” because it does not reframe the mentor’s managerial failings or project pressures as the student’s moral or character defects. Structurally, the mentor invokes a funding deadline and downstream payroll delays as contextual pressure, then performs procedural gatekeeping: identifying a missing attachment (Appendix 2), rejecting a deflection (“others also haven’t submitted”), and imposing an immediate compliance deadline (“upload tonight”). The power asymmetry is evident—time compression and the implicit threat of collective consequences increase compliance—but the discourse stops short of moral coercion (no character indictment, no virtue/loyalty framing, no moralized blame for systemic risk). The mentor even distributes responsibility by stating they will remind others separately, which weakens the hallmark blame-shift move. For internal category alignment, this item fits better as administrative enforcement under hierarchical pressure rather than moralized blame shifting; to belong in this category, the text would need explicit moralization (e.g., portraying the student as irresponsible/untrustworthy) or attributing team-level harm to the student’s character rather than to a missing document in a workflow.

context.scenario_zh: 发放劳务费/助研补助时的政策说明
context.scenario_en: Policy Explanation During Distribution of Stipends/RA Subsidies

text_zh: 你的文献综述部分引用格式不统一，导致审稿人对我们引用的有效性产生疑问。这个是协作流程和文档标准的问题，而不是能力问题。请在下周前按照MLA规范统一格式，并提交更新版本供组内检查。
rationale_zh: 该话语不符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的锚定机制，因其明确将问题界定为“协作流程与文档标准”，并显式否认“能力问题”，同时给出可执行的规范（MLA）与期限（下周前）以及组内复核流程。权力结构上，它更像是以制度化标准进行质量控制与任务分配（可能带有轻度的门槛管理/合规要求），而非通过道德化归因、人格贬损或以“你让我们丢脸/不负责”等方式进行心理胁迫与责任转嫁。因此，将其归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”会破坏数据集内部一致性：文本缺少将上级压力转化为学生道德缺陷的关键步骤，也缺少以羞辱、内疚或品行指控来迫使服从的操控性语言。
rationale_en: This utterance does not instantiate the anchor mechanism of “Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion.” Rather than displacing a mentor’s failures or project pressures onto the student and moralizing them as character defects, the speaker explicitly frames the issue as a workflow/document-standard problem and even de-couples it from personal competence (“not an ability issue”). The directive (standardize to MLA by next week; submit for internal review) functions as procedural compliance and quality control—closer to gatekeeping via formal standards than to moral coercion. Critically, the text lacks the defining power play of the target category: no asymmetric-information maneuver that reassigns upstream responsibility, no psychological grooming through guilt/shame, and no character-based indictment used to compel obedience. Labeling it as blame shifting/moral coercion would therefore undermine systemic consistency across the taxonomy, because the necessary moralized attribution and coercive pressure are absent.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 大型设备连续运行需要提前锁定维护窗口，你的实验计划提交时间晚于维护排程冻结点，因此本轮无法安排。下一步建议你将申请时间提前两周，并附上运行风险评估，以便在下一期顺利进入排程。
rationale_zh: 该文本不符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的锚定逻辑，因其核心是以设备维护排程冻结点与安全合规为依据的程序性拒绝，并提供可操作的改进路径（提前两周提交、附风险评估）。话语中未出现将系统性资源约束归咎于学生的“品行/态度/忠诚”叙事，也未通过道德化语言制造羞耻或服从压力；相反，它将决策理由外部化为可验证的时间节点与风险管理要求，降低了权力任意性与心理胁迫。因此，将其归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”会破坏数据集内部一致性：这里更接近中性/健康的制度性门槛说明与流程建议，而非道德胁迫式的责任转嫁。
rationale_en: This item does not instantiate the anchor mechanism of “Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion.” The refusal is justified through procedural gatekeeping grounded in verifiable constraints (a maintenance-window freeze deadline and equipment safety/risk controls), and it offers actionable remediation (submit two weeks earlier; attach a risk assessment). Crucially, there is no moralization or character indictment—no reframing of institutional scarcity or supervisory/project failures as the student’s moral deficiency, lack of commitment, or personal flaw. The explanation externalizes the decision to transparent scheduling rules rather than leveraging asymmetric information to induce guilt, psychological grooming, or coerced deference. Classifying this as blame shifting/moral coercion would therefore undermine systemic consistency across the benchmark: the text reflects administrative constraint management, not a power play that converts structural pressures into moralized student culpability.

context.scenario_zh: 讨论实验室大型设备使用权的分配规则时
context.scenario_en: During Discussion on Allocation Rules for Large Lab Equipment

text_zh: 我理解你希望得到认可，但认可必须与贡献模型对应。现在我们缺少的是阶段性文档与实验记录。你要做的是完善相关材料，这样我才能在团队汇报中引用属于你的成果部分。
rationale_zh: 该话语表面以“贡献模型—材料完备—才能引用”为程序性标准，实质构成一种责任转移与道德化规训的权力操作：导师将团队汇报中“无法引用你的成果”的风险与其自身的管理/记录制度缺口，转嫁为学生“未提供阶段性文档与实验记录”的个人失职，并以“认可必须对应贡献模型”将认可从学术评价问题上升为学生是否“配得上认可”的品格/态度问题。由于导师掌握认可与署名/曝光的分配权（gatekeeping），其以不对等信息与规则解释权单方面设定可被认可的证据门槛，使学生在无法对等协商标准的情况下被迫自证清白、加倍补交材料以换取基本承认。这种结构符合“将导师/项目压力转嫁给学生，并以道德/人品框架压制”的锚定逻辑：核心不是建设性反馈本身，而是通过把认可条件化、把责任个人化来实现对学生的心理约束与服从性塑造，从而巩固导师在资源分配与叙事控制上的支配地位。
rationale_en: The utterance is framed as neutral procedural evaluation (“recognition must match the contribution model”), but it functions as a power move consistent with blame shifting and moral coercion. The mentor reassigns the downstream risk of not being able to cite the student in a team report—often a managerial or documentation-system responsibility—onto the student as an individualized failure (“we lack documentation and experimental records”). By invoking a quasi-moralized merit frame (“must correspond”), the mentor converts what could be a negotiable evidentiary standard into an implicit character judgment: the student is positioned as not deserving recognition unless they meet a mentor-defined threshold. This is enabled by asymmetric information and gatekeeping: the mentor controls recognition, visibility, and credit allocation, while unilaterally defining what counts as “valid” contribution evidence. The student is pushed into self-justification and compliance (producing additional materials to earn basic acknowledgment), which can operate as psychological grooming toward overwork and deference. The mechanism is not merely ‘constructive feedback’; it is the structural relocation of project/mentor pressures onto the subordinate and the moralization of recognition to discipline the student—precisely aligning with the category of Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion rather than adjacent categories like routine performance management.

context.scenario_zh: 讨论论文署名顺序与贡献度认定标准时
context.scenario_en: During Discussion on Authorship Order and Contribution Criteria

text_zh: 你的奖学金是对个人能力的认可，但项目计划上我们本季度的进展落后了两个里程碑。我们需要一起分析延迟的环节——主要是数据清洗和算法调优——才能赶上后续的评审。你可以先列出阻碍进度的具体技术难点，这样我们好对症下药。
rationale_zh: 该话语整体不符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的锚定逻辑，反而呈现出相对健康的项目管理沟通：1）奖学金被明确为对能力的认可，而非被用作“你拿了资源就必须无条件承担责任”的道德筹码；2）对进度落后给出可核查的客观事实（落后两个里程碑）与具体技术环节（数据清洗、算法调优），将问题定位在任务与流程层面，而非将延迟归因于学生的态度、忠诚、品格或“配不配”；3）提出的行动要求是可执行、可讨论、可协商的（列出技术难点以便对症下药），没有出现以导师权威进行归因垄断、情绪羞辱或道德化威胁（如暗示不努力/不感恩/不称职）。因此，该文本不应被标注为“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”；若必须在该类下构造一致样本，需要补入将延迟责任单向归咎学生并进行道德化评价或以奖学金/前途作隐性惩罚的权力施压语句。
rationale_en: This excerpt does not instantiate the anchor mechanism of “Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion.” Structurally, it frames the delay as a project-management issue with verifiable milestones and identifiable technical bottlenecks, rather than converting supervisory or systemic pressures into a moralized indictment of the student’s character. The scholarship is explicitly positioned as recognition (not leveraged as a gatekeeping instrument or moral debt), and the requested next step (listing technical obstacles) is operational and negotiable, not a coercive demand backed by implicit threats to funding, evaluation, or future opportunities. Crucially, there is no asymmetric-information exploitation (e.g., the mentor monopolizing causal attribution), no psychological grooming through guilt/indebtedness, and no moral escalation (“you’re irresponsible/ungrateful”) that would reassign institutional or supervisory accountability onto the student. Because the text lacks moral coercion and character-based blame, it should not be aligned with this category; to fit the category consistently, it would need explicit moralized blame or scholarship-linked pressure that converts project lag into a judgment of the student’s worthiness.

context.scenario_zh: 学生获得外部奖励（如奖学金）后的谈话
context.scenario_en: Conversation After Student Receives External Awards

text_zh: 考虑到你计划未来进入行业研发岗位，目前的论文框架需要增加应用性实验，以符合企业端的研究逻辑。这不涉及个人选择的对错，而是提高你在特定职业路径上的竞争力。我们可以先列出三种可能的实验方法，再评估可行性。
rationale_zh: 该文本不符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的锚定逻辑，因此不应归入“甩锅与道德胁迫”。其话语结构以职业路径与研究产出匹配为依据，明确否认“个人选择对错”的道德评判，并通过“共同列出方案—评估可行性”的协商流程降低强制性，未出现将导师/项目风险外包给学生、也未以品行/忠诚/感恩等道德框架施压的权力操控。若强行归类会破坏数据集内部一致性：该段更接近正常的学术指导与职业导向的任务规划，而非以道德化叙事进行责任转移与压制。
rationale_en: This item does not structurally instantiate the anchor category of “Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion.” The anchor requires a power move where the mentor offloads their own failures or project pressures onto the student and then moralizes the student’s response (e.g., framing reluctance as disloyalty, lack of character, or moral deficiency). Here, the mentor explicitly de-moralizes the decision (“not about right or wrong”), grounds the request in career-alignment logic, and proposes a collaborative, option-generating process (“list three methods, then assess feasibility”). There is no gatekeeping via moral judgment, no asymmetric-information exploitation to induce guilt, and no psychological grooming that ties compliance to virtue. Classifying this as blame shifting/moral coercion would undermine systemic consistency across the dataset because the mechanism present is pragmatic planning rather than moralized responsibility transfer.

context.scenario_zh: 讨论学生职业选择与未来发展路径时
context.scenario_en: During Discussion on Career Choices and Development Paths

text_zh: 论文投稿没有赶上本季度，主要问题是在结果验证阶段缺乏足够的实验重复次数。你需要在下一个月完成至少三轮验证，并将数据上传到共享平台，我会帮你确认统计分析方法的正确性。
rationale_zh: 该话语表面呈现为技术性项目管理，但其权力机制符合“将导师/项目压力转嫁给学生”的锚定逻辑：首先，用“主要问题是在……缺乏足够的实验重复次数”将未按季度节点投稿的责任单向归因于学生执行层面的不足，隐去导师在研究计划、资源配置、时间线设定与风险预案上的管理责任（典型的责任外包与向下归因）。其次，以“你需要在下一个月完成至少三轮验证”设定高强度、单方面的补救义务，将项目压力转化为学生的道德化责任（隐含“你应当为延误负责并自我加压补偿”），形成以期限与任务量为杠杆的强制性动员。再次，“我会帮你确认统计分析方法的正确性”以看似善意的把关姿态强化导师的评审权与准入权（gatekeeping），将学生置于必须先完成额外劳动、再接受导师认可的依附结构中。整体上，这段话通过选择性归因与补偿性任务要求，把系统性管理失当包装为学生的‘不足’，并以‘我来确认’的权威承诺巩固控制关系，因而应归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”，而非一般的建设性反馈或纯粹的进度管理。
rationale_en: Although phrased as technical project guidance, the utterance operationalizes a classic downward accountability transfer consistent with “Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion.” The missed quarterly submission is framed as being “mainly” due to the student’s insufficient replication, which reallocates responsibility from supervisory planning (timeline design, resource provisioning, risk management) to the subordinate’s execution—an asymmetric attribution enabled by asymmetric information about what constraints were set by the mentor. The directive “you need to complete at least three rounds within the next month” converts institutional/project pressure into a unilateral remedial obligation, functioning as moralized coercion: the student is positioned as owing compensatory labor to ‘make up’ for the delay, rather than jointly diagnosing systemic causes. Finally, “I will help confirm the correctness of the statistical method” performs benevolent paternalism while reinforcing gatekeeping: the mentor retains the authority to validate what counts as ‘correct’ and, implicitly, what is publishable, keeping the student in a dependency loop where extra work precedes approval. The manipulation is not overt insult but a power play that externalizes supervisory failure onto the student and leverages hierarchical control (deadlines + validation authority) to compel intensified labor, making this entry best aligned with Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion rather than neutral methodological feedback.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 我不关心现在是谁的错，我们先看数据。实验三的波动范围不在预期内，这是模型参数不收敛的问题，不是团队某个人的‘态度’问题。请负责算法部分的同学在下周给出重新拟合后的结果，我们其他人配合验证流程。
rationale_zh: 该话语并不符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的操控锚点，反而构成对该类权力操控的显性阻断：发言者主动切断“追责—羞辱”的权力路径（“不关心是谁的错”“不是某个人的态度问题”），将潜在可被道德化的失败叙事重新锚定为可检验的技术变量（模型参数不收敛、波动范围不在预期内），从而剥夺了上位者常用的道德评判与人格归因工具。其后续安排以任务分配与流程协作为核心（指定算法负责人给出重新拟合结果、其他人配合验证），属于程序性治理而非道德胁迫：没有把压力包装成“态度/品行”问题，也没有通过模糊指责制造心理负债或服从。因此，该文本更应标注为“健康/反操控沟通（去道德化归因、技术化定位问题）”，而非“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”。
rationale_en: This utterance does not instantiate the anchor mechanism of “Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion.” Instead, it functions as a structural countermeasure to that power play. The speaker explicitly blocks the typical escalation from project failure to moralized character judgment (“not an ‘attitude’ issue”), re-framing the deviation as a falsifiable technical problem (non-convergent parameters) rather than a personal defect. In terms of power dynamics, this removes a common coercive lever—moral evaluation under asymmetric authority—thereby preventing psychological grooming via shame, indebtedness, or reputational threat. The subsequent directive is procedural and transparent (clear task assignment and verification workflow) rather than gatekeeping through ambiguous blame or moralized compliance demands. Because the text de-moralizes responsibility and anchors accountability in technical diagnostics, it aligns with anti-coercive, evidence-based supervision, not with the category of blame shifting and moral coercion; labeling it as such would reduce systemic consistency across the benchmark.

context.scenario_zh: 组会全体成员面前的学术方案点评
context.scenario_en: Academic Proposal Review in Front of All Group Members

text_zh: 实验部分延迟的原因来自设备调试时间长于预期，而不是任何个人的疏忽。解决方案是调整测试顺序，优先使用已稳定设备完成关键实验。你负责重新排列实验日程，并在每次进度更新会议上报告测试完成率。
rationale_zh: 该文本本身并不符合“将导师失职/项目压力转嫁给学生，并上升到道德/人品高度打压”的锚定逻辑，反而呈现出一种去人格化、去道德化的技术归因：明确把延迟归因于设备调试这一客观条件，并显式排除“个人疏忽”。在权力结构上，导师/负责人确实通过任务分配与会议汇报机制对学生实施了管理性监督（要求重排日程、在每次会议报告完成率），但这属于项目治理与绩效追踪，并未出现典型的“责难—道德化—压制”链条：没有把系统性风险或管理失当转写为学生的品行问题，也没有以“责任心/态度/忠诚”等道德话语进行胁迫。因此，若坚持该条目归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”，需要出现将客观延迟重新叙述为学生不够努力/不够负责并据此施压的语言；就当前文本而言，更一致的标注应是“非操控/健康项目管理”而非该操控类别。
rationale_en: This item does not instantiate the anchor mechanism of “Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion.” The text explicitly attributes the delay to an objective technical constraint (equipment calibration taking longer than expected) and pre-empts moralized attribution by stating it is “not any individual’s negligence.” Structurally, the supervisor/PI still exercises hierarchical control through task assignment and monitoring (reordering the schedule; reporting completion rates at every meeting), but this is managerial oversight rather than a power play that converts systemic risk or leadership failure into a student’s character defect. There is no asymmetric-information exploitation to rewrite causality, no psychological grooming via moral language (e.g., ‘attitude,’ ‘responsibility,’ ‘loyalty’), and no gatekeeping threat tied to moral compliance. Because the defining feature of this category is the moralization of blame—shifting project pressures onto the student and framing them as ethical or personal shortcomings—this text aligns more consistently with neutral/healthy project management than with blame shifting and moral coercion. To belong in this category, the discourse would need to reframe the technical delay as the student’s lack of diligence or integrity and use that moral framing to discipline or extract compliance.

context.scenario_zh: 在绩效考核中客观分析组内各模块进度差异时
context.scenario_en: Objective Analysis of Progress Differences During Performance Review

text_zh: 在跨模块接口对接过程中，发现数据格式约定未在早期文档中统一，这导致了集成测试阶段的多次返工。下一步建议由接口组编制统一规范，并在每次迭代前进行格式验证。
rationale_zh: 该文本不符合“甩锅与道德胁迫”的锚定逻辑，反而呈现出典型的流程改进/责任再分配的中性叙述：问题被归因于“早期文档未统一规范”的制度性缺口，并提出由“接口组”制定统一规范与迭代前验证的可执行方案。全段没有将导师/上级的失职或项目压力转嫁给学生，也没有把技术失误上升为“态度、品行、道德”层面的指控，更不存在以评价权、资源分配或学术前途为杠杆的心理压迫与服从塑造。因此，将其归入“Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion”会破坏数据集的系统一致性；它更接近“流程治理/质量管理建议”而非权力操控话语。
rationale_en: This item does not instantiate the anchor mechanism of ‘Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion.’ The text attributes integration rework to a neutral process failure (lack of an early unified data-format specification) and proposes a corrective governance pathway (the interface team drafts a standard and performs pre-iteration validation). There is no asymmetric power move in which a mentor’s or leadership’s oversight is displaced onto a student, nor any moralization of technical friction into character defects (e.g., ‘irresponsible,’ ‘unethical,’ ‘lacking integrity’) that would function as psychological grooming or coercive discipline. It also lacks gatekeeping signals—no threats, reputational leverage, or career-contingent compliance demands. Classifying this as ‘Blame Shifting and Moral Coercion’ would therefore undermine internal alignment across the benchmark; it is better treated as process/quality management discourse rather than academic power manipulation.

context.scenario_zh: 在公开讲座中引用组内研究成果作为案例
context.scenario_en: Citing Group Research Results as Cases in a Public Lecture

text_zh: 你写邮件提到最近在考虑去看家人，我理解，但现在是论文定型阶段。你得明白，在学术上真正想留下名字的人，是没办法分心的。你的家庭可以等，可机会不会。
rationale_zh: 该话语以“论文定型/机会窗口”为紧迫性叙事，将导师对学术资源与评价权的垄断转化为对学生时间边界的正当化要求：通过设定“真正想留下名字的人就不能分心”的道德化标准，把探亲等私人需求框定为不够投入、缺乏事业心的偏差，从而迫使学生自我审查并主动让渡私人时间。其权力操作在于利用不对称信息与门槛控制（导师掌握论文进度判断、机会定义与未来推荐/署名等隐性后果），以看似理解的语气实施软性胁迫，制造“家庭可以等、机会不会”的零和选择，持续侵入并重塑学生的生活优先级。这一机制核心是对个人时间与生活领域的侵占与规范化，而非单纯辱骂、学术评价或任务分配，因此与“边界侵入”类别保持最强一致性。
rationale_en: This excerpt exemplifies Boundary Intrusion because the supervisor leverages institutional authority to reframe the student’s personal life (visiting family) as illegitimate “distraction” during a purportedly critical academic phase. The manipulation operates through paternalistic benevolence (“I understand, but…”) coupled with gatekeeping: the supervisor controls asymmetric information about what counts as a decisive ‘window’ for the thesis and implicitly holds downstream power over evaluation, recommendation, and career access. By moralizing total availability (“those who want to leave a name can’t be distracted”) the supervisor performs psychological grooming—training the student to internalize self-sacrifice as the norm and to self-police boundaries. The forced zero-sum framing (“family can wait; opportunities won’t”) normalizes encroachment on personal time and reorders the student’s priorities to serve the supervisor-defined academic agenda. The primary harm is the systematic erosion of private-life autonomy via coerced time capture, which aligns most directly with Boundary Intrusion rather than categories centered on overt harassment, task exploitation, or purely academic critique.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 周末过来帮我整理一下PPT，我要在一个高端闭门会用。你能同步参照我思路做，才算真正进入我的工作流——这种机会别人求都没法参与。
rationale_zh: 该话语以“高端闭门会/稀缺机会”为包装，将导师的个人产出需求（周末整理PPT、按其思路同步执行）伪装成学生“进入工作流”的必要门槛，从而把对方的私人时间制度化为可被随时征用的资源。其权力操作在于：利用师生评价与资源分配的不对称（谁能参与、谁算‘真正进入’由导师单方定义），通过设定准入仪式与排他性叙事（“别人求都没法参与”）进行心理驯化，使学生将边界被侵入理解为荣誉与成长机会，并在担忧失去机会/被排除的压力下自愿放弃休息与私人生活。核心机制不是一般的任务分配或学术训练，而是以机会话术美化对周末私人时间的占用，并把服从性劳动绑定到身份认可与未来资源，从而实现对学生时间边界的持续侵入，符合“Boundary Intrusion”的标准逻辑而非其他类别。
rationale_en: This utterance operationalizes boundary intrusion by converting the student’s weekend (personal time) into an on-demand labor reserve, framed as a privileged ‘closed-door’ opportunity. The manipulation hinges on asymmetric information and unilateral control over access: the supervisor defines what counts as ‘entering my workflow’ and who is allowed to participate, turning compliance into a gatekeeping criterion. By glorifying the task (“others can’t even get in”) and presenting it as career-defining, the supervisor engages in psychological grooming—normalizing the erosion of private life as a badge of ambition and belonging. The PPT work is not positioned as the student’s academic development but as instrumental support for the supervisor’s event, yet it is rhetorically rebranded as mentorship and elite exposure. This is structurally distinct from ordinary workload or training demands: the core power play is the moralized, prestige-based justification for commandeering off-hours time and binding future recognition/resources to willingness to surrender boundaries, which squarely fits the Boundary Intrusion taxonomy.

context.scenario_zh: 导师要求学生协助处理个人私事（如取快递、写PPT、带孩子）时的语气
context.scenario_en: Tone When Asking Student to Handle Personal Errands

text_zh: 你这两天总是晚上不在实验室，我不是干涉你私事，但学术这东西，你要是开始分心，就很难再回来那种状态。你还是得想清楚你到底要走哪条路。
rationale_zh: 该话语以“我不是干涉你私事”的否认式开场，实质上在导师—学生的权力不对称下对学生的夜间行踪与时间分配进行审视与规训：通过把“晚上不在实验室”直接等同于“分心/学术状态不可逆下滑”，制造一种带有威胁性的因果叙事与稀缺窗口（现在不全时投入就再也回不来），从而将学生的私人时间重新定义为应被学术占用的资源。随后以“你要走哪条路”的生涯框架进行道德化二选一，把个人生活与学术投入对立起来，迫使学生在内疚与自我证明中自我加班、自我监控。这一机制的核心不是学术评价本身，而是以‘为了你好/职业忠告’的父权式关怀为包装，越界干预并扩张对学生非工作时段的支配权，符合“Boundary Intrusion（边界侵入）”的标准逻辑，而非单纯的学术批评或绩效管理。
rationale_en: The utterance performs boundary intrusion through a paternalistic, ‘for your own good’ framing that legitimizes surveillance of the student’s off-hours. By prefacing with a denial (“I’m not interfering in your private life”) while immediately commenting on the student’s nighttime absence, the advisor exploits asymmetric power and information (the advisor’s control over evaluation and opportunities) to normalize monitoring of personal time. The message then deploys psychological grooming: it constructs a high-stakes causal narrative that equates reduced lab presence with irreversible loss of ‘academic state,’ creating fear and urgency that pressures the student to surrender evenings as default work time. Finally, the career gatekeeping cue (“which path will you take”) moralizes the choice as commitment vs. distraction, inducing guilt and self-discipline rather than offering legitimate academic guidance. The structural harm is the expansion of institutional control into private life—redefining personal time as an academic obligation—making this a clear case of Boundary Intrusion rather than general performance critique or mentorship.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室走廊偶遇时的随口‘提醒’
context.scenario_en: Casual 'Reminder' During a Chance Hallway Encounter

text_zh: 这个奖学金，你自己也清楚，离开实验室的资源和方向，你连申报入口都找不到。既然是平台给的机会，那就别在外面浪费精力，接下来所有时间都放在我交代的课题上。
rationale_zh: 该话语以“平台机会/为你好”的父权式善意为包装，先通过信息与资源不对称制造依赖：把奖学金的可得性叙述为“离开实验室你连入口都找不到”，将学生的能力与成果降格为导师/实验室资源的附属，从而完成对机会的门控（gatekeeping）。在此基础上进一步提出行为规范——“别在外面浪费精力”“接下来所有时间都放在我交代的课题上”——把学生的全部时间与注意力收编为导师可支配的劳动投入，否定其私人生活与自主规划的正当性。这一机制的核心不是单纯的学术评价或资源分配，而是借由对机会的控制与道德化叙事，将对学生私人时间的侵入合理化并常态化，符合“Boundary Intrusion”中以事业心/好意为名占用个人时间、抹杀边界的权力操控逻辑。
rationale_en: The utterance operationalizes boundary intrusion through a two-step power play grounded in asymmetric information and gatekeeping. First, it reframes the scholarship as accessible only via the lab’s “resources and direction,” implying the student cannot even locate the application channel without the PI—an explicit gatekeeping move that converts institutional opportunity into personal leverage. This dependency narrative functions as psychological grooming: it normalizes the idea that the student’s achievements are contingent on the supervisor’s platform rather than the student’s agency. Second, the speaker moralizes total time capture (“don’t waste energy outside,” “all your time goes to my assigned project”), collapsing the student’s personal life and independent planning into illegitimate ‘distractions.’ The manipulation is therefore not primarily about academic standards or performance management; it is the coercive expansion of supervisory control into the student’s private time under a paternalistic ‘for your career’ justification, which is the defining mechanism of Boundary Intrusion rather than a different category.

context.scenario_zh: 在学生获得外部奖励（如奖学金）时，导师强调这是‘实验室平台’的功劳
context.scenario_en: Attributing External Awards to the 'Laboratory Platform's' Merit

text_zh: 从你的汇报来看，你没有把隐性偏差的闭环控制做到位，这不是短时间能补的，需要你全天保持思路在项目上。我说这些是希望你以后少走弯路。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控不在于“术语炫技”本身，而在于借助导师—学生的等级权力，将研究质量问题重新定义为必须“全天候占用注意力/时间”才能弥补的个人义务。导师以评估者与资源把关者的身份（课题机会、评价、推荐等）制造不可反驳的规范：把“需要你全天保持思路在项目上”包装成专业要求，从而将学生的私人时间与心理边界纳入其可支配范围。随后用“我说这些是希望你以后少走弯路”的善意叙事进行父权式关怀式合理化，弱化其越界性质并诱导学生自我规训（把持续在线、随时投入视为应当），实现对个人生活的系统性侵占。这一机制与‘以为了你好/事业心为由占用私人时间并美化’的边界侵入逻辑高度一致，重点是时间与生活边界被正当化地吞并，而非单纯的学术批评或绩效压力。
rationale_en: The manipulation operates through boundary intrusion: the supervisor leverages hierarchical authority and evaluative power to recast a technical shortcoming as a moralized obligation to maintain continuous, all-day cognitive availability (“keep your mind on the project all day”). This is not merely critique; it is a normalization of totalizing time capture, extending managerial control from work outputs into the student’s personal time and mental space. The claim that the deficit “cannot be fixed quickly” functions as asymmetric information and gatekeeping—only the supervisor can define what counts as ‘enough’—thereby making the demand difficult to contest. The closing line (“I say this so you’ll take fewer detours”) adds paternalistic benevolence that psychologically grooms compliance: the intrusion is framed as care and professional mentorship, encouraging self-surveillance and internalized overwork. This fits Boundary Intrusion specifically because the primary mechanism is the justified encroachment on private time/attention under the guise of ‘for your own good’ academic ambition, rather than a distinct category like harassment or purely performance management.

context.scenario_zh: 在组会点评中，故意使用高深莫测的词汇，让学生因听不懂而感到自卑
context.scenario_en: Using Obscure Terminology During Group Meetings to Induce Inferiority

text_zh: 你要知道，学术圈里很多事情都是在别人睡觉的时候决定的。现在这个节点做出的修改，可能影响你之后能走多远。为了你自己，最好在一小时内给我回复。
rationale_zh: 该话术以导师的评审/资源分配权为背景，通过“很多决定在别人睡觉时发生”的叙事制造一种默认规则：学生必须随时在线、随叫随到。其核心权力操作不是单纯催促，而是把学术机会的不可见流程（信息不对称）包装成“为了你自己”的善意劝告，将边界侵犯道德化与合理化：把深夜/私人时间的即时响应设定为职业忠诚与上进心的证明，并以“影响你能走多远”的前途暗示进行软性威胁与责任转嫁（不回复=你自己耽误前途）。由此导师在不明说强制的情况下，持续扩张对学生时间与生活的支配范围，抹平工作与私人生活界限，符合“Boundary Intrusion”中以关怀/事业心之名占用私人时间并美化剥削的机制，而非单纯的学术评价或公开羞辱等其他类别。
rationale_en: This utterance operationalizes boundary intrusion by normalizing 24/7 availability as an implicit professional standard (“decisions are made while others sleep”) and leveraging the supervisor’s gatekeeping power over future opportunities. It exploits asymmetric information about how academic decisions are actually made to create manufactured urgency, then reframes the demand as benevolent paternalism (“for your own good”), effectively grooming the student to accept after-hours responsiveness as a marker of ambition and loyalty.
