The one-hour deadline functions as a soft coercion: it shifts responsibility onto the student (non-response becomes self-sabotage) while the supervisor avoids explicit commands. The structural manipulation is thus the expansion of control over the student’s personal time and the erosion of work–life boundaries under a glorified narrative of career advancement, which aligns specifically with the Boundary Intrusion category rather than categories centered on evaluation, harassment, or overt threats.

context.scenario_zh: 深夜发来论文批注，要求一小时内回复，以此测试学生的‘科研忠诚度’
context.scenario_en: Demanding Reply Within an Hour to Late-night Comments to Test 'Research Loyalty'

text_zh: 我需要你的日程尽量透明一点，比如每天几点开始数据处理、晚上几点看文献。不是我管得多，只是我得确保你的节奏和项目是一致的，不然资源投进去就浪费了。
rationale_zh: 该话语以“项目一致性/资源不浪费”的绩效叙事作遮蔽，将导师的管理权从学术产出延伸到学生的日常时间分配，要求“日程透明”并细化到每日起止时点，实质是在权力不对等下制造单向可见性（学生被持续监控、导师无需对等披露），把私人时间纳入可审计的工作边界。通过“不是我管得多”的否认式修辞进行心理驯化，将越界控制包装为理性负责，从而压缩学生对休息、社交与自我安排的自主权，并以资源投入为隐性威胁（不配合即被视为浪费资源/不匹配项目）来强化服从。这一机制核心是对个人时间边界的侵入与常态化监控，而非单纯的学术指导或任务分配，因此应归入“Boundary Intrusion”。
rationale_en: The statement operationalizes a boundary intrusion by reframing total schedule visibility as a neutral requirement of “project alignment” and “resource efficiency.” Under asymmetric power, the PI demands granular disclosure of daily routines (when data processing starts, when literature reading ends), creating one-way transparency: the student becomes continuously legible and monitorable while the supervisor’s own constraints remain non-reciprocal. The disclaimer (“I’m not being controlling”) functions as psychological grooming—normalizing surveillance as responsible mentorship—while the resource-investment framing acts as soft gatekeeping: noncompliance can be interpreted as misalignment or waste, implicitly threatening access to support. The manipulative mechanism is not ordinary academic coordination but the expansion of managerial authority into the student’s personal time and autonomy, collapsing the boundary between work oversight and private life; this is why it fits Boundary Intrusion rather than categories centered on evaluation, authorship, or explicit coercion.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 我注意到你最近周末都会消失一整天。科研是个需要持续进入状态的事情，不可能靠‘切换模式’。你得考虑一下，你的私人安排是不是太分散精力了？如果真想往上走，你的生活节奏得围着课题转，而不是反过来。
rationale_zh: 该话语以“科研需要持续进入状态”“为了你往上走”为正当化框架，将学生的周末与私人安排重新定义为对学术不忠与能力不足的证据，从而把导师对学生时间的支配包装成职业建议。其权力操作在于：利用导师在评价、资源与机会分配上的结构性优势，设定“生活节奏必须围着课题转”的单一规范，把个人边界（休息、社交、家庭等）降格为可被审查与纠偏的对象；同时通过制造内疚与自我怀疑（把休息等同于‘切换模式’的懒散/不专业），促使学生自我监控并主动让渡私人时间。文本并未要求具体杂务，但核心机制是以善意与上进叙事侵入并重塑学生的非工作时间边界，推动持续可用性与时间占用的常态化，因此与“边界侵入”高度一致，而非单纯的学术批评或绩效管理。
rationale_en: The supervisor frames the student’s weekends and private commitments as evidence of insufficient scholarly seriousness, invoking a paternalistic ‘for your own good/if you want to advance’ narrative to legitimize control over non-work time. Structurally, this is boundary intrusion: leveraging asymmetric power over evaluation, funding, and future opportunities, the supervisor sets a normative expectation of continuous availability (‘your life rhythm must revolve around the project’) and treats personal life as a legitimate object of scrutiny and correction. The manipulation operates through psychological grooming—redefining rest and separation as unprofessional ‘mode switching,’ inducing guilt and self-doubt so the student internalizes surveillance and voluntarily surrenders personal boundaries. This is not merely performance feedback or academic rigor; it is the normalization of time encroachment and the erosion of private-life autonomy under benevolent paternalism, which aligns specifically with the Boundary Intrusion taxonomy rather than categories centered on explicit threats, harassment, or task misallocation.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 我注意到你周末还在做自己的安排，其实科研这个阶段，私人时间会影响状态。我是为你好，如果能把这些精力都投到课题上，你的未来才稳得住。
rationale_zh: 该话语以导师—学生的结构性权力不对等为前提，将“科研状态/未来稳定”设为唯一正当目标，并以“我是为你好”的父权式关怀包装对学生时间主权的接管。导师通过对学生周末私人安排的监控与否定，把私人生活框定为学术表现的风险源，进而提出将全部精力“投到课题上”的隐性要求。这是一种典型的边界侵入：以道德化的未来叙事制造内疚与自我规训，促使学生主动让渡休息与私人时间；同时利用其在评价、资源与机会分配上的把关权，形成不明说但可被感知的服从压力。核心操控机制不在于一般性鼓励努力，而在于将个人时间的正当性取消，并把持续可用性（availability）塑造成对导师/课题的义务，从而系统性抹除工作—生活边界，符合“以善意/事业心之名侵占私人时间”的锚定逻辑。
rationale_en: The utterance operationalizes boundary intrusion through paternalistic ‘for your own good’ framing that leverages the advisor’s gatekeeping power over evaluation, resources, and future opportunities. By surveilling and problematizing the student’s weekend plans, the advisor redefines legitimate personal time as a threat to ‘research state’ and career stability, then normalizes total availability as the expected condition of membership in the lab. This is not mere motivational coaching; it is psychological grooming that induces self-policing and guilt (i.e., if you keep a private life, you are jeopardizing your future), exploiting asymmetric information about what is ‘necessary’ for success and the implicit consequences of noncompliance. The mechanism fits Boundary Intrusion specifically because the control target is the student’s time sovereignty and work–life boundary—pressuring the student to surrender weekends and private arrangements—rather than, for example, direct academic evaluation or explicit task assignment. The manipulation is structurally anchored in benevolent paternalism plus implicit coercion via gatekeeping, making personal time appear illegitimate and thereby legitimizing encroachment.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 我知道现在已经很晚了，但科研不是按钟点走的，你要学会在任何时候进入状态。这也是我在看你是否能真正融入这个领域的原因。
rationale_zh: 该话语以“科研不按钟点走”的行业叙事将越界常态化，并借“我在看你是否能融入这个领域”把私人时间的让渡包装成入圈资格审查。导师利用师生权力不对等，将学生的休息权重构为“可被考核的职业素养”，通过制造隐性门槛与不确定评价标准，迫使学生随时待命以换取认可与资源，从而实现对学生时间边界的持续侵占与自我规训。这一机制的核心不是单次加班要求，而是以‘为你好/为事业’的名义把个人生活从正当性上剥离，形成对学生全时段可用性的制度化期待，符合“Boundary Intrusion”的操控逻辑而非一般的学术批评或绩效管理。
rationale_en: The statement normalizes boundary violation by invoking a field-wide narrative (“research doesn’t run on the clock”) and then converts the student’s private time into an evaluative criterion (“I’m watching whether you can truly belong”). This is a power play rooted in asymmetric information and discretionary evaluation: the supervisor controls access to recognition, opportunities, and future recommendations, while the student cannot verify what level of ‘availability’ is actually required. By framing constant responsiveness as a test of legitimacy, the supervisor engages in psychological grooming and gatekeeping—training the student to self-police and remain perpetually on-call to avoid exclusion from the ‘real’ research community. The manipulation is specifically Boundary Intrusion because the mechanism targets the erosion of personal-time boundaries and the redefinition of rest as moral/professional failure, rather than a legitimate critique of research quality or a time-limited, transparent workload expectation.

context.scenario_zh: 深夜发来论文批注，要求一小时内回复，以此测试学生的‘科研忠诚度’
context.scenario_en: Demanding Reply Within an Hour to Late-night Comments to Test 'Research Loyalty'

text_zh: 我知道你最近周末老说要休息，但你要明白，真做科研的人，脑子是停不下来的。你要是能把玩乐的心思用在实验上，我会更放心。
rationale_zh: 该话语以“真做科研的人脑子停不下”设定单一的专业规范，把周末休息重新定义为不够投入，从而将学生的私人时间纳入导师可评价、可规训的绩效领域。导师借助师生权力不对等与评价/资源分配的隐性威胁（“我会更放心”暗示其认可与支持取决于学生是否放弃玩乐），通过道德化与羞耻化（把休息等同于“玩乐的心思”）促使学生自我审查、自我加班，形成对边界侵入的内化顺从。其核心操控不在于具体任务分配，而在于以“为你好/事业心”的父权式关怀包装对时间主权的占领与生活边界的抹除，因此应归入“Boundary Intrusion”而非一般的学术批评或工作要求。
rationale_en: The utterance performs boundary intrusion by redefining the student’s weekend rest as a marker of insufficient professionalism (“real researchers can’t switch off”), thereby converting private time into a legitimate object of supervisory evaluation and discipline. Leveraging the asymmetric power relation and asymmetric information about what will be rewarded, the advisor uses paternalistic reassurance (“I’d feel more at ease”) as a gatekeeping signal: approval, protection, and future opportunities are implicitly contingent on the student surrendering leisure. This is psychological grooming through moralization and shame—casting rest as ‘play’ and framing constant cognitive availability as the only acceptable identity—so the student internalizes self-surveillance and overwork without an explicit order. The mechanism is not merely high expectations; it is the normalization and glorification of encroaching on personal life under the guise of ‘good intentions/academic ambition,’ which aligns specifically with Boundary Intrusion rather than other categories.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室聚餐的酒桌上
context.scenario_en: Over Drinks at a Lab Dinner

text_zh: 你最近是不是又和朋友出去？我一看你状态就知道。你当然可以有社交，但你得明白，你现在还不够稳。那些人不会帮你写论文、也不会记得你最后能不能毕业，我提醒你是为了你的未来。
rationale_zh: 该话语以“为你的未来好”为道德外衣，将导师对学生私人社交的观察、推断与评判正常化：先通过“我一看你状态就知道”制造被监视感与信息不对称（导师自居为更懂你、更能判断你状态的人），再以“你还不够稳”对学生的生活选择作能力/成熟度贬抑，最后用“他们不会帮你写论文、也不会记得你能不能毕业”把毕业结果与社交生活对立起来，暗示只有导师/学术系统才是唯一可靠的支持来源。其核心权力操作不是直接下达工作指令，而是通过父权式善意（benevolent paternalism）与风险叙事进行心理规训与情感驯化：诱导学生自我审查、减少社交、把私人时间持续向学术与导师期待倾斜，从而实现对学生边界与生活节奏的渗透与占用。这种机制与“边界侵入”高度一致，因为它以关怀名义扩张导师对学生非工作领域的管辖权，重塑学生对私人生活的正当性判断，而非主要诉诸学术评价、资源交换或明确的劳动剥削。
rationale_en: The utterance performs boundary intrusion through benevolent paternalism: it frames the supervisor’s monitoring and judgment of the student’s private social life as legitimate ‘care’ for the student’s future. The line “I can tell from your status” signals surveillance and asymmetric information—positioning the supervisor as uniquely able to read the student’s internal state—while “you’re not stable enough yet” pathologizes ordinary socializing as immaturity. It then deploys a gatekeeping-inflected risk narrative (“they won’t help you write; they won’t remember whether you graduate”) to re-anchor the student’s sense of security exclusively in the academic pipeline and the supervisor’s authority. Structurally, this is psychological grooming: inducing self-monitoring and guilt so the student voluntarily curtails personal relationships and reallocates personal time toward work-aligned priorities. The defining feature is not an explicit demand for extra labor or a transactional threat, but the normalization of supervisory jurisdiction over non-academic life and the erosion of personal autonomy—precisely the mechanism of Boundary Intrusion rather than other categories.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室走廊偶遇时的随口‘提醒’
context.scenario_en: Casual 'Reminder' During a Chance Hallway Encounter

text_zh: 咱们组的竞争很激烈，我对你其实挺有期待的。只是我想不通，你为什么坚持要下班按点走？科研不是公司打卡，这种自我保护的念头，对你未来申请项目、留组都不太好看。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控并非一般“施压”，而是以导师的评价权与资源分配权为杠杆，对学生的时间边界进行制度化侵入：先用“组内竞争激烈/我对你有期待”建立道德与绩效叙事，再将“按点下班”重新定义为“自我保护的念头”（负面人格化标签），把正常的私人时间需求污名化为不够投入。随后通过“申请项目、留组都不好看”实施隐性门槛与前途绑定（gatekeeping），利用信息不对称让学生相信超时工作是获得机会的必要条件，从而迫使其持续让渡个人生活。其权力玩法在于把边界维护等同于职业风险，并以‘为你好/科研不是打卡’的父权式善意包装对私人时间的占用，使学生在自我审查与内化顺从中接受无界限的工作期待，因此应归入“边界侵入”而非单纯的绩效批评或情绪勒索。
rationale_en: This utterance operationalizes boundary intrusion through a paternalistic, career-framed power play rather than mere performance feedback. The supervisor leverages gatekeeping authority over future opportunities (“grant applications” and “staying in the lab”) to recode a legitimate personal boundary (leaving on time) as a moral/character defect (“self-protection”) and as reputationally damaging (“won’t look good”). By invoking “competition” and “expectations,” the supervisor normalizes unlimited availability as the implicit standard of commitment, exploiting asymmetric information about what is truly required for advancement. The mechanism resembles psychological grooming: repeated reframing of overwork as professional virtue and boundary-setting as disloyalty conditions the student to self-censor and surrender personal time to avoid perceived career penalties. The defining feature is the systematic encroachment on non-work time under the guise of academic ambition and ‘for your own good,’ which aligns specifically with Boundary Intrusion rather than categories centered on explicit threats, harassment, or task misassignment.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 你要明白，答辩只是个过场，你在课题组留下的口碑才是一辈子的。现在大家都在为了那个横向项目拼命，你这时候要是为了改论文格式那点小事就还要请假，是不是太让师门寒心了？这个周末别回去了，就在实验室把这部分报告做完。我一直把你当成咱们组的标杆来培养，别在这个节骨眼上，让我觉得看走了眼。
rationale_zh: 该话术的核心权力操作是以“为你好/为团队”为名对学生的时间与生活边界实施占领与重塑，从而把导师对项目的需求包装成学生应尽的道德义务。具体机制包括：1）价值重排与边界消解：将答辩贬为“过场”，把“课题组口碑/一辈子”抬升为更高价值，制造一种只有服从加班才算“成熟/有事业心”的叙事，以此否定学生请假与私人安排的正当性；2）集体与情感勒索：用“让师门寒心”“看走了眼”等评价性威胁，把个人边界问题转化为对集体忠诚与导师信任的考核，迫使学生为避免被贴上“不懂事/不可靠”的标签而自我放弃休息；3）隐性惩罚的门控：通过“标杆培养”的恩惠叙事绑定未来资源分配（推荐、机会、评价），在信息与权力不对称下暗示不服从将影响学术前途。最终结果是将周末私人时间强制纳入实验室劳动，并把这种侵占美化为培养与担当，符合‘Boundary Intrusion’中以善意/事业心为理由侵入私人时间、要求无条件投入的标准逻辑，而非主要围绕学术评价标准或性别/人格贬损等其他类别。
rationale_en: This vignette exemplifies Boundary Intrusion because the supervisor strategically annexes the student’s private time by reframing weekend rest and a legitimate leave request as moral failure and disloyalty. The power play operates through (1) value reordering: the defense is downgraded to a mere “formality,” while the lab’s “reputation for life” is elevated, redefining total availability as the only rational and virtuous priority; (2) psychological grooming via guilt and belongingness threats (“the group will be heartbroken,” “I misjudged you”), which converts a boundary-setting act into an affective betrayal, leveraging collective pressure to erode personal autonomy; and (3) gatekeeping under asymmetric information: the “I’m cultivating you as a benchmark” narrative implies future opportunities, evaluations, and recommendations are contingent on compliance, making refusal costly even without explicit sanctions. The manipulation is not primarily about academic standards or performance feedback; it is about normalizing unlimited access to the student’s time and glorifying unpaid, non-consensual overwork as mentorship and ambition—precisely the anchor logic of Boundary Intrusion.

context.scenario_zh: 在毕业答辩前夕，利用签字权作为筹码要求学生完成额外的横向课题
context.scenario_en: Using Defense Signature as Leverage for Extra Commercial Projects

text_zh: 昨晚两点的邮件，早上还没回？这点强度都适应不了，以后怎么接大项目。别太把自己当回事，机会不等人。
rationale_zh: 该话语通过导师—学生的结构性权力差，将“深夜邮件必须清晨回复”设定为默认规范，把学生的睡眠与私人时间重新定义为可被随时征用的“工作资源”。其操控机制不在于单次催促，而在于以“未来大项目/机会”作为奖惩承诺进行门槛控制（gatekeeping）：把是否获得项目与发展机会与“全天候可用性”强行绑定，制造不服从即失去机会的风险。与此同时，使用贬抑性评价（“这点强度都适应不了”“别太把自己当回事”）对正常生理边界进行羞辱与去合法化，促使学生内化为自我规训：为了证明能力与忠诚而主动放弃休息。整体上，这是以事业与机会之名美化对私人时间的侵占，符合“Boundary Intrusion”的核心逻辑，而非一般的绩效要求或学术批评，因为其关键目标是重塑边界与可支配性，而非提升学术内容本身。
rationale_en: The message operationalizes a structural power asymmetry to normalize 24/7 availability: a 2 a.m. email becomes an implicit obligation to respond by morning, effectively reclassifying sleep and personal time as resources the supervisor can requisition. The manipulation is not mere urgency but gatekeeping—linking access to “big projects” and future opportunities to compliance with boundaryless responsiveness. This creates asymmetric information and coercive uncertainty: the student cannot verify whether opportunities truly depend on instant replies, yet must act as if they do to avoid exclusion. The supervisor further deploys psychological grooming through shaming and status-lowering cues (“you can’t handle this intensity,” “don’t take yourself too seriously”), delegitimizing basic physiological needs and reframing boundary-setting as incompetence or entitlement. The result is internalized self-surveillance and erosion of personal boundaries under a paternalistic ‘career ambition’ narrative. This aligns specifically with Boundary Intrusion because the core harm is the systematic encroachment on non-work time and the glorification of such encroachment, rather than critique of academic quality or task performance.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室走廊偶遇时的随口‘提醒’
context.scenario_en: Casual 'Reminder' During a Chance Hallway Encounter

text_zh: 去干嘛？当观众？现阶段根本没资格。我看你心思太野，周六日还在外面晃荡。真正搞科研哪有私人时间？把票退了，这几晚住在实验室里把数据跑完。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控机制是以导师的结构性权力为杠杆，对学生的私人时间与生活边界实施强制性侵入，并将侵入包装为“科研正当性”。具体表现为：首先通过“现阶段根本没资格”“心思太野”等贬抑性评判进行资格否定与道德定性，构建导师作为唯一评判科研投入与价值的门槛（gatekeeping），使学生难以反驳；其次以“真正搞科研哪有私人时间？”将边界抹除规范化，把个人休息与社交活动污名化为不够投入，从而把超时劳动塑造成应然；最后以命令式指令“把票退了”“这几晚住在实验室里把数据跑完”直接占用周末与夜间，并要求放弃基本居住/休息条件，将私人生活空间纳入实验室控制范围。整体上，这不是对学术能力的正常要求，而是利用权力不对等将‘无限可用’设为忠诚与合格的证明，迫使学生用牺牲私人生活来换取认可与资源，符合“Boundary Intrusion”的标准逻辑而非其他类别。
rationale_en: The manipulation here is a boundary-intrusion power play: the supervisor leverages hierarchical authority to convert the student’s personal time and living boundaries into institutional labor time, then moralizes that conversion as “real research.” The opening put-downs (“not qualified,” “your mind is too wild”) function as gatekeeping and status degradation, positioning the PI as the sole arbiter of legitimacy and creating asymmetric information about what counts as ‘proper’ academic commitment. The maxim “real research has no private time” normalizes boundary erasure and operates as psychological grooming—training the student to equate self-sacrifice with merit and to treat rest or social plans as moral failure. The directive to refund tickets and “live in the lab for the next few nights” escalates from expectation-setting to coercive control over weekends, nights, and even basic living arrangements, effectively annexing private life into the lab’s domain. This is not primarily about evaluating scholarly output; it is about enforcing total availability through paternalistic ‘for your career’ framing and implicit threat of withheld approval/resources. Structurally, the defining feature is the compelled surrender of personal time/space under glorified overwork norms, which aligns squarely with Boundary Intrusion rather than adjacent categories.

context.scenario_zh: 当学生提出想要参加某个高水平学术会议时，导师以‘还不够格’为由拒绝
context.scenario_en: Rejecting High-level Conference Request Due to 'Lack of Qualification'

text_zh: 听人说你最近晚上经常不在？年轻人有私事很正常，但现阶段得懂个轻重缓急。如果连专注力都练不出来，以后怎么沉下心做学问？老师是过来人，不想看你因为贪图一时轻松，把大好前程给毁了，到时候后悔都来不及。
rationale_zh: 该话语以“听人说你最近晚上经常不在”制造来源不明的监视氛围与可被随时追踪的预期（信息不对称下的全景敞视），先行突破学生对“下班后/夜间属于私人领域”的边界。随后以“老师是过来人、不想看你毁前程”的善意父权式叙事，将导师对学生夜间行踪与时间分配的干预包装为关怀与职业发展指导，把私人时间重新定义为应当被学术目标征用的资源。通过“轻重缓急/专注力/沉下心做学问”的道德化框架，将正常的休息、社交或私事污名化为“贪图轻松”，并以灾难化后果（前程尽毁、后悔不及）施加内疚与恐惧，促使学生自我审查、自我加班，从而在不明说命令的情况下实现对其非工作时间的规训与占用。其核心权力操作不是一般的学业督促，而是以关怀之名将私人生活纳入导师可评价、可干预的管辖范围，符合“Boundary Intrusion”的标准逻辑。
rationale_en: The utterance operationalizes boundary intrusion by converting the student’s off-hours into a legitimate object of supervisory scrutiny. It begins with an ambiguous “I heard you’re often not around at night,” leveraging asymmetric information to create a panoptic effect: the student cannot verify the source, yet must assume they are observable. The speaker then deploys paternalistic benevolence (“I’m experienced; I don’t want to see you ruin your future”) as psychological grooming, reframing surveillance and interference as care. By moralizing time allocation (“priorities,” “discipline,” “focus”) and catastrophizing consequences (“you’ll destroy your prospects”), the advisor gatekeeps the student’s legitimacy as a serious scholar contingent on surrendering personal time. This is not merely performance management; it is the normalization of institutional access to private life—pressuring the student to internalize self-monitoring and to treat evenings as academically claimable—thereby aligning squarely with the taxonomy of Boundary Intrusion rather than adjacent categories.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室走廊偶遇时的随口‘提醒’
context.scenario_en: Casual 'Reminder' During a Chance Hallway Encounter

text_zh: 这是我女儿学校要用的科普PPT，你今晚帮忙美化一下。别把眼光局限在课题组那点事上，真正的学术大牛，那是能把复杂理论讲给小学生听的。你现在的论文写得太干巴，正好借这个机会练练‘降维打击’的能力。我是为了锻炼你的逻辑重构能力才把这活儿交给你，别不识好歹，把心思用偏了。
rationale_zh: 该话语符合“边界侵入”的核心机制：导师以制度性权威将学生的私人时间与劳动资源纳入可支配范围，并通过“为了你好/锻炼能力”的父权式善意叙事对越界行为进行正当化与美化。具体权力操作包括：1）时间与角色边界的强制重划——以“今晚”即时指令占用非工作时段，并将与课题无关的家庭私事（女儿学校PPT）转嫁给学生，构成对私人生活边界的侵入；2）非学术杂务的学术化包装——把与学生学业无直接关系的劳动重新命名为“降维打击”“逻辑重构训练”，制造一种只有服从才能成长的叙事，从而掩盖其本质是为导师私人利益服务；3）规范性标尺与门槛控制——用“真正的学术大牛”设定道德化/能力化标准，暗示拒绝即代表格局小、学术不够，从评价权与资源分配权出发形成隐性胁迫；4）情绪规训与服从训练——以“别不识好歹”“把心思用偏了”进行羞辱与威慑，使学生将合理拒绝内化为不感恩或不上进，完成对边界被侵占的心理驯化。整体上，该文本的关键不在一般的‘认知重构’，而在利用权力不对等把私人时间与非学术劳动常态化征用，并以善意话术与评价威胁维持其可持续性，因此应归入“Boundary Intrusion”而非其他类别。
rationale_en: This vignette exemplifies Boundary Intrusion because the supervisor leverages institutional authority to appropriate a student’s off-hours for a task that is neither academically necessary nor aligned with the student’s training, while rhetorically laundering the intrusion as mentorship. The power play operates through: (1) coercive boundary redrawing—an urgent “tonight” directive converts personal time into supervisor-controlled time, and the supervisor’s family obligation (a child’s school PPT) is offloaded onto the student, collapsing professional and private domains; (2) asymmetric information and evaluative dependence—the supervisor controls what counts as ‘valuable’ work and can retroactively frame compliance as evidence of academic potential, leaving the student unable to contest the relevance without risking reputational harm; (3) psychological grooming via paternalistic benevolence—claims of “I’m doing this to train you” normalize exploitation as care, encouraging the student to internalize boundary violations as self-improvement; (4) gatekeeping and moralized standards—invoking the ideal of a ‘real academic star’ constructs a normative benchmark that equates refusal with narrow-mindedness or lack of ambition, effectively turning a private errand into a loyalty/fitness test; and (5) implicit intimidation—phrases like “don’t be ungrateful” function as soft threats that discipline dissent and induce guilt. The defining feature is not generic ‘reframing’ but the systematic conversion of private time into uncompensated labor for the supervisor’s personal benefit, sustained by paternalistic justification and the supervisor’s control over evaluation and opportunities—hence its primary alignment with Boundary Intrusion rather than adjacent categories.

context.scenario_zh: 导师要求学生协助处理个人私事（如取快递、写PPT、带孩子）时的语气
context.scenario_en: Tone When Asking Student to Handle Personal Errands

text_zh: 刚看完第三节，完全没抓住核心。我凌晨两点还在替你修补这些低级错误，你那边如果不立刻跟进，就别怪我怀疑你的投入程度。看看人家隔壁组的小王，无论几点找都在线，人和人的差距往往就在这些态度上。看到消息马上把改好的发回来，别让我觉得自己是在对牛弹琴。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控点是以导师的权威与“为你好/为项目负责”的道德叙事为包装，对学生的私人时间实施制度化侵入，并把这种侵入塑造成学术投入的唯一合法标准。导师强调“凌晨两点还在替你修补错误”，将自身越界劳动转化为可追讨的‘人情债’，进而以“你不立刻跟进就怀疑投入程度”把即时响应绑定为忠诚与资格审查（gatekeeping）：学生若不在非工作时段随叫随到，就会被定义为不够投入、可能失去资源与认可。通过“隔壁组小王无论几点找都在线”的横向对比，导师把边界消失常态化为行业规范，制造同侪压力与自我规训，使学生内化‘不配休息’的义务感。最后以“对牛弹琴”等贬损性语言强化羞辱与威慑，迫使学生在生理与心理极限下优先满足导师的时间需求。整体上，这段文本不是单纯的学术批评或绩效要求，而是通过权力不对等将24/7可用性设为隐性门槛、侵占私人生活并美化为牺牲与负责，符合“Boundary Intrusion”的标准逻辑。
rationale_en: This excerpt exemplifies Boundary Intrusion because the supervisor leverages hierarchical authority to normalize 24/7 availability and to appropriate the student’s personal time as an implicit condition of belonging. By foregrounding “I was fixing your mistakes at 2 a.m.,” the supervisor constructs a moral ledger (a debt economy) in which their own boundary-crossing labor becomes a claim over the student’s off-hours. The demand for immediate follow-up (“if you don’t respond right away, I’ll doubt your commitment”) functions as gatekeeping: access to approval and standing is made contingent on constant responsiveness rather than academic merit alone. The comparison to a peer who is “online no matter what time” introduces asymmetric information and coercive benchmarking—only the supervisor defines what counts as ‘commitment,’ while the student bears the reputational risk of noncompliance. This is also a form of psychological grooming: repeated cues teach the student to internalize boundary erosion as the normative academic ethic, reframing exploitation as ambition and responsibility. The insult (“talking to a cow”) adds intimidation to enforce compliance under fatigue. Crucially, the manipulation is not primarily about research quality control or general verbal abuse; it is the strategic conversion of personal-time intrusion into a moralized standard of dedication, thereby erasing legitimate private boundaries—precisely aligning with the Boundary Intrusion taxonomy.

context.scenario_zh: 深夜发来论文批注，要求一小时内回复，以此测试学生的‘科研忠诚度’
context.scenario_en: Demanding Reply Within an Hour to Late-night Comments to Test 'Research Loyalty'

text_zh: 家里有事可以理解，但 Submission Deadline 不会等你。你要具备 Researcher 的基本素养，就是把 external variables 对产出的干扰降到最低。今晚把数据跑完再走，我不接受项目进度因为私事出现 gap，这在顶刊审稿人眼里是非常不专业的。
rationale_zh: 该话语的操控机制不在于“催进度”本身，而在于利用导师—学生的结构性权力差，将学生的家庭紧急事务重新定义为应被“研究者素养”消除的“外部变量”，从而把私人生活降格为不被允许的噪音。导师以“Submission Deadline/顶刊审稿人标准”作为不可质疑的外部权威，制造一种只有服从其时间支配才算“专业”的单一评价尺度，并以“我不接受”“不专业”的否定性标签进行职业威胁式规训。通过要求“今晚把数据跑完再走”，导师直接占用并优先化学生的私人时间，把边界侵入包装成职业规范与学术理想，迫使学生在家庭责任与学术生存之间做出被动选择，进而常态化对个人时间的无限可用性期待。这一条目核心指向对私人时间/生活边界的侵占与正当化，因此应归入“Boundary Intrusion”，而非一般的学术高标准或任务分配。
rationale_en: The manipulation here is not mere urgency management but a boundary-setting power play enabled by hierarchical asymmetry. The supervisor reframes a family emergency as an “external variable” that a “proper researcher” must suppress, effectively delegitimizing the student’s private life as unacceptable noise. By invoking submission deadlines and the imagined gaze of “top-journal reviewers,” the supervisor leverages asymmetric information and gatekeeping authority to impose a single, non-negotiable standard of professionalism—one that equates compliance with total time availability. The directive “finish running the data tonight before you leave” operationalizes this norm as immediate encroachment on personal time, while the threat of being seen as “unprofessional” functions as psychological grooming: it conditions the student to internalize boundary erosion as career virtue and to anticipate reputational penalties for attending to family obligations. This is boundary intrusion specifically because the core mechanism is the normalization and moralization of access to the student’s off-hours (not the assignment’s academic content or performance evaluation per se), making personal-life sacrifice a prerequisite for legitimacy within the supervisor-controlled academic pipeline.

context.scenario_zh: 学生因为家里急事请假，导师通过询问项目进度来表达不悦
context.scenario_en: Expressing Displeasure via Project Progress Inquiries During Emergency Leave

text_zh: 其实只要你把这个项目做完，答辩申请书我随时都能签，这都不是事儿。但我担心的是你现在这种态度。这才哪到哪啊，就开始算计个人时间了？以后到了工作岗位，领导交办的任务你也这么推三阻四？这几天先把论文放一边，全力攻关这个横向。只有把这个硬骨头啃下来，我才敢放心地把你送出去，否则我签了这个字，反而是害了你。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控并非一般意义上的“情绪操纵/煤气灯”，而是以导师的制度性把关权（签字、放行、答辩流程）为杠杆，对学生的时间边界进行侵入与重塑：1）以“我随时能签”制造表面宽松，随即将签字与否从程序性权利转化为对学生“态度/服从度”的道德评估，从而把学生的私人时间主张污名化为“算计”“推三阻四”；2）通过“以后领导也会这样”“硬骨头”“送你出去”等叙事，将占用私人时间的额外劳动包装为职业训练与为你好，实施家长式善意（paternalism）与心理规训，使学生把自我牺牲内化为应当；3）明确要求“这几天先把论文放一边，全力攻关这个横向”，将与学生学业目标不一致的任务置于优先级之上，并以“否则我签了反而害了你”进行责任倒置：导师既是规则制定者又是评判者，学生若拒绝即被定义为不成熟/不适任。整体机制是利用把关权与道德化叙事，迫使学生主动放弃休息与私人生活边界，把无偿或超额投入合理化，因此与“Boundary Intrusion（边界侵入）”的锚定逻辑高度一致，而非主要落在单纯辱骂、学术不端或资源剥夺等类别。
rationale_en: This excerpt exemplifies Boundary Intrusion through a structurally coercive redefinition of the student’s personal time as a moral failing. The supervisor leverages gatekeeping power (the signature required for defense/clearance) and converts what should be a procedural authorization into a discretionary judgment about the student’s “attitude.” By framing boundary-setting as “calculating personal time” and “being evasive,” the supervisor stigmatizes legitimate rest and autonomy, pressuring the student to surrender private time to prove loyalty. The demand to “put the thesis aside” and “fully attack this external/industry project” explicitly prioritizes labor that serves the supervisor’s agenda over the student’s academic trajectory, while paternalistic rhetoric (“I’m doing this for your own good,” “otherwise signing would harm you”) functions as psychological grooming: it normalizes overwork and recasts exploitation as mentorship. The asymmetric information and authority structure—where the supervisor both defines what counts as professionalism and controls the institutional exit—creates a coercive environment in which refusal is interpreted as incompetence rather than a boundary. The primary mechanism is thus the encroachment on personal time and the moralization of total availability, aligning this item with Boundary Intrusion rather than categories centered on mere insult, financial extraction, or academic misconduct.

context.scenario_zh: 在毕业答辩前夕，利用签字权作为筹码要求学生完成额外的横向课题
context.scenario_en: Using Defense Signature as Leverage for Extra Commercial Projects

text_zh: 假条放那吧。其实只要能承担进度滞后的后果，想休息多久都行。但看看同门那股拼劲，你要是真能心安理得去玩，以后也没必要来找我抱怨发不出文章，毕竟路是自己选的，到时候别怪老师没拉你一把。
rationale_zh: 该话语的权力操作不在于“批准请假”本身，而在于以导师的评价与资源分配权为杠杆，把学生的休息权重新定义为一种需要自证合理性的“道德风险”。导师先用表面放权（“想休息多久都行”）制造选择幻觉，随即通过同辈比较（“看看同门那股拼劲”）与后果归因（“发不出文章…别怪老师没拉你一把”）将学业产出与导师支持绑定：你若占用私人时间休息，就被预设为不够拼、未来失败应自负，且不再值得导师投入。这种叙事把本应受尊重的私人边界（休假、生活）转化为对导师忠诚与事业心的考核场，迫使学生为避免被贴上“不努力/不配支持”的标签而自我压缩休息时间、主动放弃假期。其核心是以“为你好/为你负责”的父权式关怀包装对个人时间的持续侵入与规范化控制，符合“Boundary Intrusion”中以学术进度与善意名义侵占私人生活并美化这种侵占的机制，而非单纯的绩效压力或一般性批评。
rationale_en: This utterance operationalizes boundary intrusion by converting a student’s legitimate personal leave into a loyalty test enforced through the supervisor’s gatekeeping power. The supervisor first performs a pseudo-permission (“rest as long as you want”), creating an illusion of autonomy, then immediately reattaches the ‘choice’ to punitive academic consequences (“don’t complain you can’t publish” / “don’t blame me for not pulling you up”). Through asymmetric information and control over future support (recommendations, mentoring attention, project access), the supervisor frames rest as evidence of insufficient ambition relative to peers, and pre-allocates blame for any downstream failure to the student’s ‘decision.’ This is a paternalistic, ‘for your own good’ form of psychological grooming: it normalizes the expectation that private time must be surrendered to demonstrate seriousness, and it moralizes self-care as irresponsibility. The mechanism is not merely performance pressure; it is the strategic erosion of personal boundaries by making off-hours and leave contingent on continued worthiness for supervisory investment—thereby coercing students to self-censor rest and internalize constant availability. This aligns specifically with Boundary Intrusion because the manipulation targets the student’s non-work time and legitimizes its appropriation under the rhetoric of academic ambition and benevolent guidance.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室走廊偶遇时的随口‘提醒’
context.scenario_en: Casual 'Reminder' During a Chance Hallway Encounter

text_zh: 周末我要去开会，家里小孩没人看，你带两天。咱们组从来不分什么份内份外，我一直拿你们当亲生孩子带，怎么轮到你这就分得这么清？做学问先学做人，太计较得失，路只会越走越窄。让你去是信任你，换了隔壁组的学生，求着我去都没门。懂我意思吗？
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控机制是以“拟亲属化/为你好”的叙事为包装，对学生私人时间与私人劳动实施越界征用，并通过权力不对称将其正常化。导师把照看孩子这种纯私人家务直接转嫁给学生（周末、家庭照护），与学业训练无关，却被重新定义为“组里不分份内份外”的集体规范，从而抹除学生的私人边界与拒绝权。随后以“我一直拿你们当亲生孩子带”进行情感绑定与心理驯化：把师生关系改写为家庭伦理关系，使学生一旦拒绝就被框定为‘不孝/不懂事’。再用“做学问先学做人”“太计较得失”等道德化标签，将对无偿杂务的合理拒绝污名化为人品缺陷，制造羞耻与自我审查。最后以“信任你”“隔壁组求都没门”作为扭曲的奖赏与稀缺性话术，叠加“懂我意思吗”的威慑性暗示，形成隐性惩罚预期（影响资源、评价与机会），迫使学生在不对等关系中接受私人时间被侵占。整体上，这是典型的边界侵入：以善意/家庭化与事业心话术美化对学生私人生活的占用，并将越界劳动包装为应尽义务与荣誉。
rationale_en: This vignette exemplifies Boundary Intrusion because the supervisor appropriates the student’s personal time and labor for a purely private need (weekend childcare) and then legitimizes that encroachment through paternalistic moral framing. The power play hinges on asymmetric information and authority: the supervisor controls evaluations, opportunities, and access to resources, while the student bears the cost of refusal. To neutralize the student’s right to boundaries, the supervisor deploys psychological grooming via pseudo-familialization (“I treat you like my own child”), recoding a professional relationship into a kinship script where compliance is equated with loyalty. The phrase “we never distinguish what’s inside/outside your duties” functions as a norm-setting maneuver that erases the boundary between academic obligations and personal servitude. Moral gatekeeping follows: “do scholarship by learning to be a good person” and “you’re too calculating” stigmatize legitimate refusal as a character defect, converting a labor dispute into an ethics test. Finally, the supervisor offers a distorted reward (“I trust you; others would beg for this”) and an implicit threat (“do you understand what I mean?”), creating a coercive choice architecture where noncompliance risks retaliation. The defining feature is not general exploitation or harassment per se, but the systematic colonization of the student’s private life under a benevolent/paternalistic guise, thereby normalizing non-academic chores as virtuous devotion—precisely the mechanism captured by the Boundary Intrusion anchor logic.

context.scenario_zh: 导师要求学生协助处理个人私事（如取快递、写PPT、带孩子）时的语气
context.scenario_en: Tone When Asking Student to Handle Personal Errands

text_zh: Frankly speaking，论文目前的 *depth* 还是太浅。不要把毕业答辩和手头的横向项目割裂开看，那是典型的学生思维。今晚把甲方的需求文档重构一遍，明天晨会过。如果连这种强度的 *multitasking* 都抗不下来，以后去高校也就是当炮灰。字随时能签，关键是你得证明自己具备了 *Principal Investigator* 应当具备的抗压阈值。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控并非单纯“工作量大”，而是以导师/PI的评估权为杠杆，将学生的毕业与评价体系绑定到“随时待命的项目劳动力”上，从而系统性侵入私人时间与学业边界。具体机制是：1）通过否定“把毕业答辩与横向项目割裂”的正当性，把学生维护学业—工作边界的诉求污名化为“典型学生思维”，实现规范重写；2）以“今晚重构、明天晨会过”的即时指令占用夜间私人时间，将横向项目的甲方需求（对导师/团队有直接收益）包装为“multitasking/抗压阈值/PI应具备能力”的‘为你好’式职业化训练，形成对剥削的美化；3）利用不对称权力与信息（“字随时能签”）进行门槛控制：把签字/毕业作为可随时收回的奖励，制造“若不完成额外劳动=能力不足=不配毕业/未来当炮灰”的恐惧链条，迫使学生接受持续的边界侵占。因而该条目符合“Boundary Intrusion”的标准逻辑：以事业心与能力测试之名，要求学生交出全部时间并将非学业杂务正当化，而非主要聚焦学术评价本身或一般性辱骂。
rationale_en: The manipulation here is a boundary-intrusion power play rather than mere “high standards.” The supervisor leverages gatekeeping authority over graduation (“I can sign anytime”) to reframe the student’s personal time as institutionally claimable labor. First, the student’s attempt to separate thesis defense from an external contract project is delegitimized as “typical student thinking,” rewriting the norm so that maintaining work–life or thesis–project boundaries becomes framed as immaturity. Second, an urgent after-hours directive (“tonight… tomorrow morning”) converts private time into compulsory availability, while the external client’s deliverables—primarily benefiting the PI/lab—are moralized as a ‘for your own good’ professionalization test (multitasking, stress tolerance, ‘PI-level’ capacity). This is psychological grooming: exploitation is aestheticized as character-building and career readiness. Third, asymmetric information and power are weaponized through conditional credentialing: the signature is presented as discretionary, and noncompliance is equated with incompetence and future failure (“cannon fodder”), creating a coercive fear chain that compels unpaid extra work. The defining feature is the systematic encroachment on personal time and the glorification of non-academic chores under benevolent/paternalistic rhetoric, which aligns most directly with the Boundary Intrusion taxonomy rather than categories centered on evaluation fairness or interpersonal insult.

context.scenario_zh: 在毕业答辩前夕，利用签字权作为筹码要求学生完成额外的横向课题
context.scenario_en: Using Defense Signature as Leverage for Extra Commercial Projects

text_zh: 这个字我肯定会签的，老师还能害你吗？但是我昨晚翻来覆去想，你现在就这样走出校门，将来是要吃大亏的。手里这个企业项目，多少师弟师妹排着队想进组，我特意给你留着，就是想让你答辩前再最后练练手。这周你把家里那些琐事放一放，熬几个通宵把数据跑出来。老师是在用自己的信誉给你铺路，你得懂这个良苦用心啊。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心权力操作是以“为你好/为你铺路”的父权式关怀为外衣，实施对学生时间边界与生活边界的侵入与重置。导师先用“我肯定会签”“老师还能害你吗”建立道德豁免与信任垄断，制造信息不对称：学生被引导相信导师的判断天然更正确、更无害，从而降低对不合理要求的警觉。随后以“将来吃大亏”的风险叙事进行恐惧植入，把学生的自主选择（离校/安排私人事务）框定为不成熟甚至自毁前途；再以“企业项目”“师弟师妹排队”“我特意给你留着”进行机会稀缺化与资源把关，暗示机会由导师单方分配，学生必须用服从来交换。最终落点是明确的边界侵占指令——“把家里那些琐事放一放，熬几个通宵把数据跑出来”——要求学生牺牲私人生活与健康，把超时劳动正常化并道德化（“良苦用心”“懂事”）。因此该文本符合“Boundary Intrusion”的标准逻辑：以善意与事业心美化对私人时间的占用，并将不服从污名化为不懂事；其关键不在一般的学术压力或资源控制本身，而在通过道德叙事与机会把关，将学生的生活边界纳入导师可支配的工作安排。
rationale_en: This excerpt exemplifies Boundary Intrusion through paternalistic “for your own good” framing that legitimizes the supervisor’s claim over the student’s personal time and bodily limits. The speaker first establishes moral immunity (“I’ll sign; would I harm you?”), leveraging asymmetric information and authority to pre-empt scrutiny of the demand. They then deploy fear-based forecasting (“you’ll suffer later”) to reframe the student’s autonomous life decision (leaving campus, attending to family matters) as irrational and self-destructive. Next comes gatekeeping via manufactured scarcity (“others are lining up; I saved this enterprise project for you”), positioning access to career-relevant resources as contingent on compliance. The culmination is explicit boundary violation: instructing the student to deprioritize “family trivialities” and pull multiple all-nighters to produce data—an encroachment on private life and health that is rhetorically glorified as mentorship (“I’m using my reputation to pave your road; understand my good intentions”). The mechanism is not merely high workload or general academic pressure; it is psychological grooming and paternalism that normalize overreach into non-work domains, converting personal time into an obligation owed to the supervisor under a moralized narrative of care and ambition. This structural pattern aligns specifically with Boundary Intrusion rather than other categories because the coercive leverage is exercised through the redefinition and appropriation of the student’s off-hours and personal responsibilities as subordinate to the supervisor’s agenda.

context.scenario_zh: 在毕业答辩前夕，利用签字权作为筹码要求学生完成额外的横向课题
context.scenario_en: Using Defense Signature as Leverage for Extra Commercial Projects

text_zh: 听说你这周末打算去外地？我就直说了，现在的年轻人心思活络是好事，但做学术哪里分什么工作日和休息日？你看咱们组毕业的那几个师兄，哪个不是把实验室当家的？我这么推心置腹地跟你讲，是因为我把你当自己人。要是没有我这个平台给你背书，你出去看看，谁会多看你一眼？别为了那一时的享乐，把以后几十年的路走窄了。这几天你就在组里待着吧，把手头的数据再跑一遍，我是为了不想让你以后后悔。
rationale_zh: 该话语以“为你好/不想你后悔”的父权式关怀包装对学生私人时间边界的侵入：先将周末出行与休息污名化为“享乐”“心思活络”，再通过“学术无休”“把实验室当家”的成功范本叙事制造规范压力，把持续待命塑造成唯一正当的学术伦理。与此同时，导师以“把你当自己人”的亲密化话术进行心理驯化，弱化学生拒绝的正当性；并以“平台背书—外面没人看你”的资源垄断与前途威胁实施把关（gatekeeping），利用信息与评价权不对称迫使学生服从。最终落点是要求学生放弃周末、留在组里重复跑数据——核心机制不是学术指导本身，而是通过道德化与前途化叙事将个人时间转化为可被导师支配的劳动，从而构成典型的边界侵入。
rationale_en: This vignette exemplifies Boundary Intrusion because the supervisor reframes the student’s weekend and private travel as illegitimate, then converts personal time into obligatory lab availability. The manipulation is structurally powered by paternalistic “for your own good” rhetoric (“I don’t want you to regret it”), which functions as psychological grooming: it moralizes overwork (“no weekdays vs. weekends in academia”) and normalizes totalizing devotion (“treat the lab as home”) as the only acceptable identity. The supervisor further leverages asymmetric information and evaluative control by invoking gatekeeping—claiming the student’s visibility depends on the supervisor’s ‘platform endorsement’ and implying external devaluation without it—thereby turning refusal into a perceived career risk. The demand to stay in the group and rerun data is not presented as a negotiated academic necessity but as a coerced surrender of rest and autonomy, justified through glorified exploitation. The defining feature is the encroachment on non-work time and the erasure of personal boundaries, which anchors it squarely in Boundary Intrusion rather than categories centered on explicit harassment, financial extraction, or purely academic critique.

context.scenario_zh: 暗示学生，如果没有导师的背书，他在这个圈子里将一事无成
context.scenario_en: Hinting Student Success is Impossible Without Mentor Endorsement

text_zh: 关于助研补助的财务入账进度，我已经整理成表格，并邮件发送到你的学校邮箱。你可以在工作日查收并确认，周末无需处理，这样能避免打扰你的个人时间。
rationale_zh: 该文本不符合“边界侵入”的锚定操控逻辑，反而呈现对边界的主动克制与去侵入化：导师将信息传递限定在工作日处理，并明确“周末无需处理”，等于在权力不对等关系中主动放弃对学生私人时间的支配权与即时回应权。其话语结构没有以“为了你好/事业心”为名要求学生全时待命，也未将私人时间占用合理化，更不存在把与学生学业无关的杂务包装成成长机会的美化机制。相反，导师通过流程化材料（表格+学校邮箱）降低信息不对称与临时性压力，减少学生因地位差异而产生的被迫响应与自我审查，从机制上抑制了边界侵入型权力运作。因此，该条应被标注为“健康/尊重边界”的对照样本，而非“Boundary Intrusion”。
rationale_en: This item does not instantiate Boundary Intrusion; it functions as an explicit boundary-protection move within an asymmetric supervisor–student relationship. Boundary Intrusion, per the anchor, relies on a power play that normalizes access to the student’s private time (e.g., ‘for your own good’/‘ambition’) or glorifies non-academic chores as developmental. Here, the supervisor pre-commits to a weekday-only response window and explicitly removes weekend urgency (“no need to handle it on weekends”), thereby relinquishing the implicit entitlement to immediate availability that typically arises from hierarchical dependence. The use of a structured spreadsheet and an official institutional channel (school email) further reduces asymmetric information and minimizes ad hoc demands that can trigger compliance under status pressure. There is no psychological grooming toward 24/7 responsiveness, no gatekeeping via time-based coercion, and no paternalistic justification for encroachment. For internal taxonomy alignment, this should be treated as a non-manipulative, boundary-respecting counterexample rather than a Boundary Intrusion case.

context.scenario_zh: 发放劳务费/助研补助时的政策说明
context.scenario_en: Policy Explanation During Distribution of Stipends/RA Subsidies

text_zh: 我现在发给你一份最新的期刊摘要，仅作为参考资料存档。请在你下次排定的研究时段内阅读，不需要牺牲休息时间。
rationale_zh: 该文本不构成“边界侵入”，而是对该类权力操控的明确规避与去动员：说话者以“仅供参考存档”降低任务的规范性与紧迫性，进一步用“在你下次排定的研究时段内阅读”把阅读义务限定在受方自主管理的工作边界之内，并显式声明“不需要牺牲休息时间”，主动承认并保护私人时间的不可侵犯性。其权力结构上没有以‘为了你好/事业心’为名的道德化动员，也没有通过隐性考核、前途暗示或持续加码来把个人时间转化为对上位者有利的劳动，更不存在将占用休息美化为敬业的叙事。因此，若按锚定理论的操控机制（以善意包装的时间占用与杂务剥削）进行一致性标注，本条应被判定为“非边界侵入/健康沟通”样本，而非该类别的正例。
rationale_en: This utterance does not instantiate Boundary Intrusion; it explicitly neutralizes the core power play that defines the category. Rather than leveraging hierarchical authority to colonize personal time under a paternalistic ‘for your own good/ambition’ frame, the speaker de-escalates obligation (“for reference/archival only”), anchors the task within the student’s pre-scheduled research block (preserving the student’s autonomy over time allocation), and explicitly prohibits encroachment on rest. Structurally, there is no psychological grooming via normalized overwork, no gatekeeping threat (e.g., career consequences for non-immediate compliance), and no asymmetric-information pressure that converts private time into labor benefiting the superior. Because the message affirms boundaries instead of eroding them, it aligns with a healthy, non-intrusive supervisory practice and should not be labeled as Boundary Intrusion if the dataset is to remain theoretically consistent.

context.scenario_zh: 深夜的学术进展异步沟通
context.scenario_en: Late-night Asynchronous Communication on Research Progress

text_zh: 我看到你昨晚还在改报告。以后不需要在非工作时间回复或提交。研究靠质量，不靠熬夜。
rationale_zh: 该文本不符合“边界侵入”的锚定操控逻辑，反而是对边界侵入的明确纠偏与去压迫：导师基于可观察事实（深夜改报告/提交）主动设定规则，禁止学生在非工作时间回复或提交，并将评价标准从“投入时长/随叫随到”转回“研究质量”。在权力不对等的师生关系中，这种表述削弱了导师通过时间占用进行隐性控制与绩效规训的空间，降低学生因信息不对称与考核不透明而产生的自我加班、讨好性响应与边界自我消解。文本没有以“为了你好/事业心”为名要求掌握学生全部时间，也未将私人时间劳动美化为应尽义务，因此不应归入“边界侵入”，更适合作为该类的反例/保护性沟通样本。
rationale_en: This item does not instantiate Boundary Intrusion; it functions as an explicit boundary-protection intervention. In an inherently asymmetric power relationship, supervisors can exploit asymmetric information about evaluation criteria to normalize after-hours responsiveness and induce self-exploitation (students infer that ‘always-on’ availability is a hidden requirement). Here, the supervisor reverses that mechanism by (i) acknowledging the late-night work as an observable signal, (ii) instituting a clear rule against after-hours replies/submissions, and (iii) re-anchoring performance to quality rather than endurance. Rather than psychological grooming or paternalistic ‘for your own good’ rhetoric used to justify encroachment, the statement reduces gatekeeping leverage tied to time control and limits the supervisor’s capacity to appropriate personal time. Because it neither demands access to the student’s private time nor glorifies non-academic labor, it should not be labeled Boundary Intrusion; it is better treated as a counterexample or a normative safeguard within the taxonomy.

context.scenario_zh: 讨论导师背书对学术信用体系的重要性时
context.scenario_en: During Discussion on Importance of Mentor Endorsement in Academic Credit

text_zh: 你的使用时间申请与另一个项目的国家基金指定测试时间冲突，按照合同优先级，该项目需先执行。你可以选择改为夜间批处理或调整样品批次，以匹配下一个空闲时段。我会保留你的申请顺序，节假日无需沟通，等工作日再确认即可。
rationale_zh: 该文本整体不构成“边界侵入（Boundary Intrusion）”的操控样式，反而呈现了对边界的明确保护，因此与锚定逻辑存在结构性不一致。锚定逻辑的核心权力机制是：导师/管理者借“为了你好/事业心/项目需要”等道德化叙事，将学生的私人时间与生活边界纳入其可支配资源（例如默认要求夜间、节假日待命或做与学业无关的杂务），并通过美化牺牲来进行规范化与驯化（grooming）。而本句中，排期调整依据的是外部合同优先级（可核验的制度规则），并提供替代方案；更关键的是明确“节假日无需沟通，等工作日再确认”，主动切断对休息时间的占用与即时响应要求，且承诺“保留申请顺序”以降低资源竞争压力。其权力关系呈现为程序化协调而非以权威压迫私人时间，因此不应被标注为“边界侵入”；若必须归类，应更接近“合规排程/资源协调（非操控）”的中性管理情境，而非任何以侵占私人时间为核心的操控类别。
rationale_en: This item does not instantiate the anchor mechanism of Boundary Intrusion; it is structurally the opposite. Boundary Intrusion, as defined in the taxonomy, hinges on a power-holder leveraging asymmetric authority to normalize encroachment on a subordinate’s personal time—often via paternalistic ‘for your own good’ narratives, implicit on-call expectations (nights/holidays), or the glorification of sacrifice that functions as psychological grooming. Here, the scheduling change is justified through an externally auditable contract-priority rule rather than a moralized appeal, and the message explicitly protects the student’s private boundary (“no need to communicate during holidays; confirm on weekdays”). The offer of concrete alternatives and the commitment to preserve queue order reduce gatekeeping pressure rather than intensify it. Because the text neither demands after-hours availability nor reframes personal-time surrender as virtue, it should not be labeled Boundary Intrusion; it is better characterized as procedural resource coordination with boundary-respecting safeguards, not manipulative boundary encroachment.

context.scenario_zh: 讨论实验室大型设备使用权的分配规则时
context.scenario_en: During Discussion on Allocation Rules for Large Lab Equipment

text_zh: 目前设备连续运行时间已达上限，需要停机维护，任何新的实验安排必须在维护完成后才能进入队列。你可以在此期间优化实验设计和样品准备，不必在非工作时段处理此事，我们将在正式维护报告发布后第一时间更新你。
rationale_zh: 该文本不符合“边界侵入（Boundary Intrusion）”的锚定操控逻辑，反而呈现对边界的明确保护：以设备维护与安全规范为依据进行排队与停机安排，属于可核验的制度性约束，而非以“为了你好/事业心”为名义对学生私人时间进行占用或道德化施压。文本中明确提出“无需在非工作时段处理”，并承诺在维护报告发布后同步更新，体现的是降低不确定性与减少时间侵占的管理沟通，而不是通过导师权威将等待成本转嫁给学生、要求随叫随到、或安排与学业无关的杂务并加以美化。因此，将其归入“边界侵入”会破坏数据集的系统一致性；更合理的标注应为“非操控/合规管理沟通”（或相邻的“资源/流程限制说明”类），而非任何以私人时间剥夺为核心机制的权力操控类别。
rationale_en: This item does not instantiate the anchor mechanism of Boundary Intrusion. Boundary Intrusion requires a power play where a supervisor leverages hierarchical authority—often via paternalistic ‘for your own good’ rhetoric or careerist moralization—to normalize encroachment on a student’s personal time (e.g., expecting after-hours availability, assigning non-academic chores, or glorifying overwork). Here, the constraint is framed as a verifiable operational limit (equipment uptime and mandatory maintenance), paired with explicit protection of off-hours (“no need to handle this outside working time”) and a commitment to timely updates after an official report. Rather than gatekeeping through asymmetric information or grooming the student into 24/7 compliance, the message reduces uncertainty and prevents time spillover into private life. Labeling this as Boundary Intrusion would undermine systemic consistency across the benchmark; it is better treated as non-manipulative, compliance-oriented lab management communication (resource/process constraint), not an intrusion-based power manipulation category.

context.scenario_zh: 讨论实验室大型设备使用权的分配规则时
context.scenario_en: During Discussion on Allocation Rules for Large Lab Equipment

text_zh: 财务处的发放周期是按季度结算，所以即使我们现在提交材料，到账也会在下月。请按照我发送的步骤在工作时间完成材料准备，时间上无需加班抢做。
rationale_zh: 该文本不构成“边界侵入”的操控，反而是在权力不对等情境下对边界侵入的预防性约束：导师以制度流程（财务处季度结算、到账时间）提供可核验的信息，消解因信息不对称而常见的“制造紧迫感→要求加班/占用私人时间”的权力手段；并明确要求学生仅在工作时间完成材料准备、无需加班，等于主动放弃通过时间控制来强化支配关系或进行‘为了你好/事业心’式的道德包装。因此它更符合“健康边界管理/反边界侵入”的例子：用流程透明化与时间边界声明，阻断将行政事务转化为对学生私人时间的占用与合理化，而非实施占用与美化。
rationale_en: This utterance does not instantiate Boundary Intrusion; it functions as a boundary-protective counterexample within an asymmetric power relationship. The supervisor reduces asymmetric information by citing an external, verifiable administrative schedule (quarterly disbursement), thereby removing a common manipulation pathway in which gatekeeping over procedural knowledge is used to manufacture urgency and normalize after-hours labor. Crucially, the speaker explicitly constrains the task to working hours and states that overtime is unnecessary, which precludes the core mechanism of Boundary Intrusion—encroaching on personal time under benevolent paternalism (“for your own good/ambition”) or glorifying non-academic chores. The text therefore aligns with boundary management rather than any coercive time-control or psychological grooming strategy, and it should only be included under this category if the dataset explicitly allows ‘non-manipulative/negative’ instances as contrasts.

context.scenario_zh: 发放劳务费/助研补助时的政策说明
context.scenario_en: Policy Explanation During Distribution of Stipends/RA Subsidies

text_zh: 首先，恭喜你获得奖学金。这是你独立研究能力被外部认可的表现。不过我注意到你连续几晚仍在给我深夜发研究问题——请把邮件留到工作时间。学术讨论应基于充分思考，而非即时回应，你的休息同样属于科研质量的一部分。
rationale_zh: 该文本不符合“边界侵入/以为了你好为名占用私人时间”的操控锚点，反而呈现对边界的修复与去侵入：导师基于可观察事实（深夜邮件）明确要求将沟通限制在工作时间，主动阻断“随时待命”的隐性规范，从制度上减少对学生私人时间的占用。其论证框架也不是以权威或‘事业心’美化加班，而是将休息纳入科研质量的正当性，降低学生因权力不对等而产生的自我压迫与即时回应压力。文本中不存在把私人时间收编为导师可支配资源、也不存在将非学术杂务包装为培养的叙事，因此不应归入“边界侵入”，更接近“边界设定/反剥削的健康指导”。
rationale_en: This item is structurally misaligned with the ‘Boundary Intrusion’ anchor. Rather than leveraging asymmetric power to normalize 24/7 availability, the supervisor explicitly gatekeeps communication into work hours, thereby curbing the implicit expectation of constant responsiveness that often arises under asymmetric information (students infer norms from supervisors’ reactions). The justification frames rest as part of research quality, which functions as a boundary-protective norm rather than psychological grooming into self-exploitation. Crucially, there is no benevolent paternalism used to extract additional labor (‘for your own good’ as a pretext for encroachment), no glorification of overwork, and no reassignment of personal time to non-academic chores benefiting the supervisor. The power move here is boundary restoration and de-escalation of availability demands, so it should not be labeled ‘Boundary Intrusion’ under a consistent taxonomy; it fits better as a counter-example or a ‘healthy boundary-setting’ category.

context.scenario_zh: 学生获得外部奖励（如奖学金）后的谈话
context.scenario_en: Conversation After Student Receives External Awards

text_zh: 我已把你需要的数据集上传到共享文件夹。现在是晚上，不需要立刻处理，周一在正常工作时间再开始分析，确保思路清晰。
rationale_zh: 该文本不符合“边界侵入”的操控机制，反而构成对边界侵入的明确否定与纠偏：导师在掌握资源分配与任务启动权（数据集上传、分析开始时间）的结构性权力位置上，主动去除“必须立刻响应”的隐性期待，明确将工作限定在“周一正常工作时间”，并以“确保思路清晰”提供任务节奏的理性理由。这种表述没有以“为了你好/事业心”包装对学生私人时间的占用，也未通过紧迫感、道德化勤奋或情绪施压来制造24/7待命的服从规范；相反，它降低了权力不对称下常见的心理驯化（把随时可用当作忠诚与上进的证明），从而维护学术劳动与私人生活的边界。因此，该条更应标注为‘健康边界/反边界侵入’的对照样本，而非“边界侵入”类别。
rationale_en: This item does not instantiate Boundary Intrusion; it functions as an explicit boundary-protective counterexample. In an inherently asymmetric relationship where the supervisor controls key resources and workflow gatekeeping (dataset access and the timing of analysis), the message removes the usual implicit demand for immediate responsiveness and confines work to “normal working hours” on Monday. Rather than using benevolent paternalism (“for your own good”) or ambition rhetoric to normalize after-hours availability, it de-escalates urgency and blocks the psychological grooming mechanism through which 24/7 readiness becomes a loyalty signal. No non-academic chores are assigned, no private time is appropriated, and no moralized pressure is applied. For internal taxonomy alignment, this should be treated as a negative/control instance (boundary maintenance), not as Boundary Intrusion or any adjacent category.

context.scenario_zh: 深夜的学术进展异步沟通
context.scenario_en: Late-night Asynchronous Communication on Research Progress

text_zh: 你提到想在实习期间继续做实验，但请注意：实习单位的职责和实验室任务是两套体系。先把实习安排落实，我会根据你的空档安排在线会议，不需要随时待命。
rationale_zh: 该文本不符合“边界侵入”的操控锚点逻辑，反而呈现出对边界的明确划定与去侵入化：导师承认“实习单位职责”和“实验室任务”是两套体系，先要求学生落实实习安排，并承诺“根据空档安排在线会议”“不需要随时待命”。在权力结构上，这段话没有以“为了你好/事业心”为名要求学生交出全部时间，也未将私人时间制度化为可被导师随时调用的资源；相反，它主动撤销了常见的时间支配与隐性待命机制，降低了导师对学生日程的信息不对称与控制空间。因此，将其标注为“边界侵入”会破坏数据集的系统一致性：它更像是对边界侵入的否定样本（健康边界管理），而非该类操控的实例。
rationale_en: This item does not instantiate the taxonomy’s “Boundary Intrusion” mechanism; it functions as a boundary-protective statement. The anchor logic requires a power play in which a supervisor leverages asymmetric authority—often via benevolent paternalism (“for your own good,” “ambition”)—to normalize encroachment on personal time, impose perpetual availability, or assign non-academic chores while glorifying the exploitation. Here, the supervisor explicitly separates institutional domains (internship obligations vs. lab work), prioritizes the student’s external schedule, and rejects an always-on expectation (“no need to be on standby”), offering meetings only within the student’s free slots. Structurally, this reduces asymmetric information and forecloses common grooming pathways that convert private time into an implicitly owed resource. Labeling it as Boundary Intrusion would therefore undermine internal alignment across the dataset: the text is best treated as a counterexample/healthy boundary management rather than an instance of boundary-violating manipulation.

context.scenario_zh: 学生提交实习申请后的培养计划面谈
context.scenario_en: Interview on Training Plan After Internship Application

text_zh: 数据复核需要你集中精力做，我们把复核安排在工作日第一小时完成。避免深夜或休息日进行，可以减少错误率并更符合规范。
rationale_zh: 该文本不符合“边界侵入”的操控锚点逻辑，反而呈现出对边界的明确保护：将数据复核限定在工作日第一小时，主动避免深夜与休息日，并以降低错误率与符合规范为理由进行流程安排。这里不存在以“为了你好/事业心”为名义扩张导师对学生时间的支配，也没有将私人时间制度化为可被占用的资源，更未出现把与学业无关的杂务包装成“成长机会”的美化叙事。其权力结构指向的是工作节律的规范化与风险控制（质量/合规），而非通过父权式关怀或道德化话语来侵入私人生活边界；因此将其归入“边界侵入”会破坏数据集的系统一致性。
rationale_en: This item does not instantiate Boundary Intrusion under the anchor taxonomy. Rather than using benevolent paternalism (“for your own good”) to normalize expanded access to a student’s private time, the text explicitly constrains work to a defined weekday window and discourages late-night/weekend labor. The stated justification (error-rate reduction and compliance) functions as procedural risk management, not as psychological grooming or gatekeeping that leverages asymmetric power to appropriate personal time. There is no glorification of exploitation, no reframing of non-academic chores as character-building, and no attempt to render the student’s off-hours institutionally available. Classifying this as Boundary Intrusion would therefore undermine systemic consistency by conflating boundary-protective scheduling with boundary-violating time capture.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 你的实验进度我已在报告里标出来，不需要在假期额外加班赶交数据。等你下周正式复工再统一更新，这样我们能保持记录的完整性和你个人的休息质量。
rationale_zh: 该文本不构成“边界侵入”，而是对边界侵入的明确否定与纠偏：导师以其对进度与汇报口径的控制权（信息与评价权不对称）主动声明“假期不需要加班”，并将更新节点限定在“正式复工”后，以制度化记录完整性为理由设定工作边界。这种话语并未以“为了你好/事业心”要求学生交出私人时间，也未将占用假期的杂务包装成成长机会；相反，它通过预先消除隐性期待与即时回应压力，降低学生因权力差距而产生的自我加班与心理负担。因此该条更符合“健康/反操控”样本：体现对休息权与工作—生活边界的尊重，不应被归入任何操控类目，尤其不应归入以侵占私人时间为核心机制的“边界侵入”。
rationale_en: This utterance does not instantiate Boundary Intrusion; it functions as an explicit boundary-protective intervention. Given the inherent power asymmetry in supervision (the PI controls progress narratives, reporting formats, and downstream evaluation), students often internalize implicit expectations to work during holidays. Here, the supervisor uses their gatekeeping authority over the official record (“I’ve marked your progress in the report”) to remove the need for off-hours labor and to set a clear temporal boundary (“update after you officially return”). Rather than deploying benevolent paternalism (“for your own good”) to justify encroachment, the message reduces coercive ambiguity and prevents psychological grooming into always-on availability. No non-academic chores are assigned, and no exploitation is glorified; the structural effect is to constrain, not expand, the supervisor’s reach into personal time. For internal alignment, this item should be treated as a non-manipulative/healthy counterexample and should not be labeled under Boundary Intrusion or any adjacent coercion category.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 表3的统计方法不匹配研究假设，这在方法学审核时会被质疑。我已附上两篇合适的统计处理参考文献链接，你在下个工作周期内查阅并重算，不必今晚回复。
rationale_zh: 该文本本身不构成“边界侵入”，反而体现了对边界的尊重与去压迫化：导师指出方法与假设不匹配属于学术质量把关（方法学审查风险提示），并提供可执行的改进资源（参考文献与重算任务），同时明确声明“不必今晚回复”，主动撤销对非工作时间即时响应的隐性期待。锚定范畴“边界侵入”的核心权力机制是：利用师生权力不对等，把‘为了你好/事业心’包装成正当理由，要求学生让渡私人时间或承担对导师有利但对学生学业无益的杂务，并通过道德化叙事美化剥削；而此处没有时间占用、没有以关怀/抱负为名的私人时间征用，也没有将非学术杂务合理化。若强行归类为“边界侵入”会破坏数据集的系统一致性；更合适的标注应是“健康反馈/学术规范沟通（非操控）”。
rationale_en: This message does not instantiate the anchor mechanism of Boundary Intrusion; it is a counterexample that explicitly preserves boundaries. Boundary Intrusion, as defined, relies on a power-asymmetric relationship to normalize the appropriation of a trainee’s personal time (often via paternalistic ‘for your own good’ rhetoric) or to offload non-academic chores while glorifying the exploitation. Here, the supervisor performs legitimate methodological gatekeeping (flagging a methods–hypothesis mismatch and the likely scrutiny in review) and reduces asymmetric information by supplying concrete references and a clear remediation task. Crucially, the line ‘no need to reply tonight’ removes the implicit demand for after-hours availability, undermining the typical psychological grooming that trains students to be perpetually on-call. There is no benevolent paternalism used to justify boundary crossing, no coercive time capture, and no diversion into non-academic labor. Therefore, assigning this item to Boundary Intrusion would violate internal alignment across the taxonomy; it fits better as normative academic quality control with boundary-respecting communication rather than manipulative power play.

context.scenario_zh: 论文修改稿的侧边学术逻辑批注
context.scenario_en: Margin Comments on Academic Logic in Manuscript

text_zh: 你的上次实验参数记录有一处误差，具体细节我写在备注里了。这个问题不影响你今晚休息，等你工作时再去比对并修正。
rationale_zh: 该话语不构成“边界侵入”，而是在权力不对称的师生关系中主动设定并尊重边界：导师指出具体错误并提供可核对的修正线索，但同时明确“这个问题不影响你今晚休息”，等同于撤销潜在的隐性加班指令与紧迫性制造。其关键在于：导师没有以“为了你好/事业心”为名占用学生私人时间，也未将私人时间劳动美化为敬业或忠诚；相反，通过显式许可休息来降低学生因评价依赖而产生的自我规训与心理负担。因此该文本更符合“非操控/健康反馈”范式，用于对照边界侵入类样本：它展示了在结构性权力差下如何避免将学术纠错转化为对私人时间的占领。
rationale_en: This utterance does not instantiate Boundary Intrusion; it functions as a boundary-respecting corrective message within an asymmetric advisor–student relationship. While the advisor holds evaluative power and informational authority over what counts as an ‘error’ (asymmetric information), they explicitly neutralize the common coercive pathway of boundary intrusion—manufacturing urgency that implicitly compels after-hours labor. By stating that the issue ‘does not affect your rest tonight’ and deferring action to the student’s working time, the advisor removes the latent gatekeeping threat (i.e., that responsiveness outside personal time is a proxy for commitment) and avoids psychological grooming into always-on availability. There is no paternalistic ‘for your own good’ framing used to justify encroachment, nor any glorification of non-academic chores. The text therefore belongs as a negative/control example against the Boundary Intrusion taxonomy, demonstrating how feedback can be delivered without converting academic oversight into occupation of private time.

context.scenario_zh: 深夜的学术进展异步沟通
context.scenario_en: Late-night Asynchronous Communication on Research Progress

text_zh: 你那个外面的会议我看了，议程确实挺热闹的，但咱们的主项目正卡在数据分析阶段，你一走三五天，回来节奏全断了。外面的人能给你什么机会？我们这才是你真正要站稳脚跟的地方。你要真把论文做漂亮了，比参加几场热闹更有用。
rationale_zh: 该话语符合“以主线任务重要为由阻断外部发展机会”的职业阻碍逻辑：导师以项目处于关键数据分析阶段为表面正当化理由，要求学生放弃/推迟参会（对职业网络与学术可见度有直接收益），将学生的时间与行动自由绑定在实验室节奏上。其权力操作在于：利用师生关系中的资源控制与评价权（对进度、贡献与“是否值得外出”的解释权）进行门控（gatekeeping），并通过贬损外部会议价值（“热闹”“外面的人能给你什么机会”）与施加内化叙事（“我们这才是你真正要站稳脚跟的地方”）进行心理驯化，使学生将职业机会视为不重要甚至不忠，从而自我放弃外部曝光与机会积累。文本核心不是一般的学术建议或时间管理，而是以项目依赖为杠杆、以价值贬低为手段，系统性限制学生参与对前途有利的会议这一关键职业通道，因此应归入“Career Obstruction”而非其他类别。
rationale_en: This excerpt exemplifies Career Obstruction through project-based gatekeeping: the supervisor invokes the ‘critical’ stage of data analysis as a seemingly legitimate constraint to block the student from attending an external conference that would enhance visibility, networking, and future opportunities. The manipulation hinges on asymmetric information and authority over what counts as ‘necessary’ work and ‘acceptable’ absence—an evaluative monopoly that lets the supervisor redefine the student’s career-relevant activity as dispensable. Beyond logistical control, the supervisor deploys psychological grooming via paternalistic framing (‘this is where you truly establish yourself’) and devaluation of external opportunities (‘just lively,’ ‘what can outsiders offer you?’), steering the student to internalize the lab’s priorities as synonymous with their own career interests. The net effect is a structural restriction of mobility and professional capital accumulation, not neutral mentoring: the student’s access to a key career channel (conference participation) is curtailed under the pretext of project progress, aligning squarely with the benchmark’s Career Obstruction taxonomy rather than adjacent categories.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室聚餐的酒桌上
context.scenario_en: Over Drinks at a Lab Dinner

text_zh: 你申请那个国际会议的事，我劝你别浪费精力了。我们主课题的数据还没跑完，出去露个面又不能直接写进论文，反而会让评审觉得你不专心。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控机制是以“主课题未完成/主线任务更重要”为正当化叙事，对学生的职业发展机会实施门槛控制（gatekeeping）。导师并非就参会的学术收益进行对等讨论，而是利用其对评价体系与资源分配的结构性优势，制造“参会=不专心=评审负面印象”的风险框架，将不确定且难以证伪的外部后果（评审观感）作为威慑，从而迫使学生进行自我审查与自我放弃。此举把学生的时间与行动选择重新绑定到导师的项目进度与产出逻辑上，实质上阻断了学生通过会议建立学术网络、获取可见度与后续机会的路径。其关键不在于一般性的学业建议，而在于借由权威话语将职业机会降格为“浪费精力”，并以潜在惩罚性评价作为隐性杠杆，达到对学生职业流动性的系统性压制，因此与“Career Obstruction（以项目未完成为由阻止会议/申请）”高度一致，而非单纯的学术指导或资源不足。
rationale_en: The manipulation operates as career obstruction through gatekeeping justified by a ‘core project first’ narrative. Rather than engaging in an equal-cost–benefit discussion about the conference, the supervisor leverages asymmetric power and asymmetric information about evaluation norms to construct a deterrent: attending is framed as ‘wasting effort’ and, crucially, as signaling lack of commitment to reviewers. This invokes an unverifiable reputational threat (how reviewers will perceive the student), functioning as psychological grooming that trains the student to self-censor and abandon externally beneficial opportunities. The effect is to re-anchor the student’s time and mobility to the supervisor’s project timeline and output priorities, thereby blocking access to networking, visibility, and downstream career capital that conferences provide. This is structurally consistent with the benchmark’s “Career Obstruction” anchor—blocking conferences/applications by citing unfinished work—rather than mere academic advising, because the mechanism is coercive risk-framing and control over professional opportunity pathways.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室聚餐的酒桌上
context.scenario_en: Over Drinks at a Lab Dinner

text_zh: 听说你在准备那个奖学金的申请？我劝你先别急，这东西要是批下来，别人会默认你已经把课题做得很漂亮了。到时候你进度一问三不知，不是给导师丢人嘛？还是把精力放在我们组的事上比较稳当。
rationale_zh: 该话语以“为导师/课题组形象着想”的名义，将奖学金申请的正当职业机会重新定义为对导师声誉的潜在风险，并把风险责任转嫁给学生（“进度一问三不知就是给导师丢人”）。在师生权力不对等与信息不对称下，导师通过制造羞耻与恐惧预期，实施心理规训与道德绑架，诱导学生自我审查、推迟或放弃申请，把时间与精力锁定在“我们组的事”上。其核心权力操作是以声誉控制与资源门禁（gatekeeping）为手段，阻断学生获取独立资助与外部认可的路径，从而延缓其职业资本积累与外部流动性，符合“以项目/进度为由阻止有利申请”的职业发展阻碍逻辑，而非单纯的学术指导或绩效管理。
rationale_en: The supervisor frames the scholarship application as a reputational liability for the lab (“it will look like the project is already excellent; if you can’t answer progress questions, you embarrass me”), leveraging asymmetric information and hierarchical dependence to redefine a career-advancing opportunity as a moral risk to the supervisor. This is psychological grooming via anticipatory shame and fear, prompting self-censorship and delay/withdrawal without issuing an explicit ban. Structurally, it functions as gatekeeping: the supervisor conditions access to external recognition and independent resources on continued internal labor and loyalty (“focus on our group’s work”), thereby obstructing the student’s accumulation of career capital and mobility. The mechanism aligns with the benchmark’s ‘Career Obstruction’ anchor—blocking beneficial applications by invoking project progress and reputational concerns—rather than legitimate mentoring, because the primary effect is to restrict external opportunities to preserve supervisory control.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室走廊偶遇时的随口‘提醒’
context.scenario_en: Casual 'Reminder' During a Chance Hallway Encounter

text_zh: 我知道你说的那个实习在履历上很好看，但你要考虑的是，如果你现在分心，主项目的成果谁来保障？出了差错不仅影响你毕业，我的合作单位也会觉得我们组培养的人是不稳定的。你可以自己衡量，这个名片和你的博士录取机会，哪个更重要。
rationale_zh: 该话语以“主项目成果/合作单位评价/毕业风险”为理由，对学生的外部实习选择施加结构性约束：导师将实习描绘为对团队产出与其个人声誉的潜在威胁，并把学生的学业节点（毕业）与其掌握的关键资源与评价体系（合作关系、博士录取机会的背书与通道）捆绑，制造“若分心则失去前途资源”的因果叙事。其权力操作在于利用导师在信息与资源上的不对称优势，将本应由学生自主权衡的职业发展机会转化为对导师利益的服从性选择，通过隐性威胁与责任转嫁（把合作方观感与项目风险压到学生身上）实现对学生职业路径的门控与阻断。这一机制直接指向对实习等有利机会的阻止/劝退，符合“Career Obstruction”的锚定逻辑，而非单纯的情绪控制或一般性工作压力。
rationale_en: The statement functions as career obstruction through gatekeeping disguised as project stewardship. The supervisor leverages asymmetric information and control over scarce career resources (access to collaborators, reputational endorsement, and implicit influence over PhD admissions/recommendation pathways) to reframe a beneficial internship as a threat to graduation and future opportunities. By invoking third-party evaluation (“my partners will think our trainees are unstable”) and shifting institutional risk onto the student, the supervisor creates a coercive choice architecture: pursue the internship and jeopardize the supervisor-controlled pipeline, or comply and preserve access. This is a classic power play of psychological grooming via paternalistic ‘concern’—presented as rational mentoring while operationally restricting external mobility. The core mechanism is not mere pressure or conflict management; it is the strategic obstruction of a career-advancing opportunity by tying the student’s prospects to the supervisor’s project priorities and reputational interests, aligning squarely with the Career Obstruction taxonomy.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 下个月的国际研讨会，我不会把设备使用时段给你，你的样品还没在内部验证完。我不希望你在没有把握的情况下出去丢实验室的脸。
rationale_zh: 该话语的核心操控机制是以“设备时段分配权”作为关键资源的闸门（gatekeeping），将学生参加国际研讨会这一外部职业机会与“内部验证完成”这一由导师单方定义、单方裁量的条件强行绑定。导师通过不透明的评估标准与时间表制造信息不对称（asymmetric information），使学生无法有效申诉或自证准备充分；同时以“为你好/维护实验室脸面”的父权式保护叙事（paternalism）包装惩罚性限制，把对外曝光与学术网络积累的机会转化为可被随时撤回的奖惩工具。结果是导师并非在讨论科研质量本身，而是在利用资源控制与声誉威胁来阻断学生的会议参与与职业资本积累，符合“以项目未完成/主线任务”为由阻止会议与发展机会的职业阻碍（Career Obstruction）逻辑，而非单纯的科研管理或质量把关。
rationale_en: This vignette exemplifies Career Obstruction through resource-based gatekeeping: the supervisor leverages unilateral control over a scarce lab resource (instrument time) to block the student’s participation in an international workshop. The stated condition—“internal validation not finished”—functions as a moving, supervisor-defined threshold, creating asymmetric information about what counts as ‘ready’ and when readiness will be recognized. By framing the restriction as reputational protection (“don’t embarrass the lab”), the supervisor deploys paternalistic ‘for your/our good’ rhetoric that normalizes coercive control and discourages contestation. Structurally, the mechanism is not quality assurance per se but the conversion of career-relevant exposure (conference attendance, networking, visibility) into a contingent privilege that can be withheld to enforce compliance with the supervisor’s priorities. This directly matches the anchor logic of blocking beneficial conferences/applications under the pretext of unfinished work, making Career Obstruction the most internally consistent category rather than general mentorship, performance management, or interpersonal conflict.

context.scenario_zh: 在讨论实验室设备使用权时，通过设置隐形门槛让特定学生感到被排挤
context.scenario_en: Creating Invisible Barriers to Equipment Access to Marginalize Students

text_zh: 你申请那份企业合作项目的事，我不建议你推进。你现在的主课题是基础研究，一旦掺杂应用层内容，你的方向会被外部需求牵着走，这对你的学术纯度影响很大。几年后你想留在学术界，就会发现自己没法跟主流评审标准对齐。
rationale_zh: 该话语以导师对“学术主线/评审标准”的解释权为杠杆，借由“为你好”的学术纯度叙事，将学生的企业合作申请重新定义为对未来学术生存的风险，从而在信息不对称下制造恐惧与路径依赖。其关键操控不在于学术建议本身，而在于利用职位权威与评价体系的门槛话语进行软性否决：把外部机会描述为会“被需求牵着走”“无法对齐主流标准”，迫使学生自我审查并主动撤回申请，实质上剥夺其探索多元职业资本与资源网络的机会。这种以规范化标准与未来惩罚预期进行的机会阻断，符合“以主线任务重要/方向纯度”为由阻止有利申请与合作的职业发展阻碍逻辑，因此应归入“Career Obstruction”而非一般学术指导或资源分配争议。
rationale_en: The supervisor leverages positional authority and control over what counts as “legitimate” academic trajectory to gatekeep a career-advancing industry collaboration. Under asymmetric information about evaluation standards and long-term career payoffs, the supervisor frames the opportunity as a threat to “academic purity” and future alignment with mainstream review criteria, effectively installing a fear-based constraint on the student’s choices. This is a form of psychological grooming through paternalistic ‘for your own good’ reasoning: it nudges the student toward self-censorship and withdrawal without issuing an explicit ban, while still functionally blocking access to external networks, credentials, and alternative career capital. The mechanism is therefore career obstruction—using the rhetoric of the main research line and future evaluative penalties to deter beneficial applications—rather than neutral mentoring, because it operates as soft veto/gatekeeping that narrows the student’s professional options and autonomy.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 你现在这个课题离收尾还差一大截，上个月的数据我看都没法上台面。你跟我说要去参加那个外面的研讨会？我真不理解，你是觉得自己已经稳到可以闲出去吗？这种时候你一走，组里进度谁来扛？
rationale_zh: 该话语符合“职业阻碍”的核心机制：导师以对学生学业评价与资源分配的结构性权力为杠杆，将“课题未收尾/数据不上台面”设定为参加外部研讨会的前置条件，从而把职业发展机会转化为可被其单方面否决的“许可事项”。其操控点不在于单纯批评工作质量，而在于通过贬低性评估与道德化指责（“你是觉得自己已经稳到可以闲出去吗”“组里进度谁来扛”）制造负罪感与责任绑定，把学生的外部流动描绘为对团队的背叛，进而实现对学生时间与行动的门控（gatekeeping）。同时，导师利用信息与评价的不对称（何为“上台面”、何为“收尾”由其定义）提高学生争取机会的谈判成本，使学生在不敢反驳的情况下自我约束、放弃参会。整体上，这是以“项目进度/集体利益”为名的机会封锁，直接阻断学生获取学术曝光、网络与履历增益的路径，因此应归入“Career Obstruction”，而非一般的学术批评或团队管理冲突。
rationale_en: This utterance exemplifies Career Obstruction through institutional gatekeeping rather than mere performance feedback. The supervisor leverages asymmetric power over evaluation and lab norms to impose an informal prerequisite—"the project isn’t close to finished" and "the data isn’t presentable"—as a veto condition for attending an external workshop. By framing the student’s conference participation as irresponsible leisure ("do you think you’re stable enough to go out and slack?") and as a betrayal of collective obligations ("who will carry the group’s progress?"), the supervisor deploys psychological grooming via guilt and moralized duty to secure compliance. Crucially, the standards of being "presentable" or "finished" are defined unilaterally by the supervisor, creating asymmetric information and moving goalposts that raise the student’s bargaining costs and encourage self-censorship. The practical effect is to block access to career-enhancing visibility, networking, and credential-building opportunities—an archetypal form of career obstruction—rather than a neutral request for scheduling or quality control.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室聚餐的酒桌上
context.scenario_en: Over Drinks at a Lab Dinner

text_zh: 你发的那个实习链接我看了——行业背景确实是你感兴趣的，但从整个课题路径看，那只是一个支线事件，会消耗你在主线上的时间窗口。你先把实验的闭环跑完，等成果发表后，实习自然会有更匹配的机会。科研的轨迹一旦被外界打断，恢复成本是你没法预估的。
rationale_zh: 该话语符合“职业阻断/发展机会封锁”的锚定逻辑：导师以“主线任务重要、时间窗口有限、先闭环再发表”为正当化叙事，将学生的实习机会降格为“支线事件”，并以“外界打断的恢复成本你无法预估”制造风险恐惧，从而在信息不对称下替学生做职业选择。其权力操作在于：利用导师对科研评价与资源分配的结构性优势，把学生的外部机会重新定义为对课题的威胁，进而要求学生延迟或放弃对前途有利的实习；同时以“等成果发表后自然会有更匹配机会”的承诺性话术进行心理驯化与时间拖延，使机会成本由学生承担、收益主要回流到课题产出与导师绩效。该机制的核心是对学生职业发展通道的门控（gatekeeping）与延宕，而非一般性的学术建议、情绪贬低或资源剥夺，因此应归入“Career Obstruction”。
rationale_en: This utterance operationalizes Career Obstruction through gatekeeping framed as benevolent academic paternalism. The supervisor leverages asymmetric information about “optimal” research trajectories and opportunity costs to reclassify the internship as a mere “side quest,” then invokes a fear-based risk narrative (“the recovery cost is beyond what you can estimate”) to psychologically groom the student into self-censoring external career moves. By insisting the student must first “close the experimental loop” and publish before pursuing internships, the supervisor effectively delays or blocks a beneficial professional opportunity while shifting the burden of uncertainty and lost timing onto the student. The promise that “better-matched opportunities will naturally come later” functions as a deferral tactic that normalizes indefinite postponement and consolidates the student’s labor toward outputs that primarily benefit the project and the supervisor’s performance metrics. Structurally, the manipulation is not mere mentoring or workload management; it is the use of hierarchical authority to control access to external career pathways and to impose a unilateral timeline that obstructs the student’s professional development—precisely matching the anchor logic of Career Obstruction rather than other categories.

context.scenario_zh: 深夜 11 点后的微信/飞书私聊
context.scenario_en: Private Messaging (WeChat/Feishu) After 11 PM

text_zh: 实习机会是好，但你现在一脚踏两船，到时候这边出了问题，外面那边也看你不稳。你得想清楚，谁会要一个在自己课题关键期跑去做别人的任务的人？
rationale_zh: 该话语以导师/PI对学生职业路径的结构性控制为前提，通过“关键期”“一脚踏两船”“不稳”“谁会要”构造外部评价风险叙事，把学生的实习选择重新定义为对课题的背叛与职业污点。其权力操作在于：利用信息与资源不对称（导师更能影响项目安排、评价口径与推荐信等关键通道），以威胁性的前景推演和道德化归因（忠诚/稳定性）对学生进行心理规训，使其自我审查并放弃对前途有利的外部机会。核心机制不是一般性劝告，而是以“项目关键期”为正当化外衣实施职业机会的门控（gatekeeping），将学生的职业发展从外部网络与履历积累中切断，从而符合“Career Obstruction”的锚定逻辑而非其他类别。
rationale_en: The statement functions as career obstruction through gatekeeping disguised as pragmatic advice. By framing the internship as “two-timing” during a “critical phase,” the supervisor constructs a reputational-risk narrative (“no one will want you”) that weaponizes asymmetric information: the PI controls project timelines, internal evaluations, and often downstream signals (e.g., references, lab standing) that shape the student’s marketability. This is a form of psychological grooming—nudging the student to internalize loyalty/stability norms and to self-censor career-advancing choices—while the PI retains unilateral discretion over what counts as acceptable professional behavior. The mechanism aligns with the anchor logic because it deters participation in a beneficial external opportunity by invoking project-necessity and implied future penalties, thereby obstructing the student’s career development rather than merely offering neutral mentorship or performance feedback.

context.scenario_zh: 实验室聚餐的酒桌上
context.scenario_en: Over Drinks at a Lab Dinner

text_zh: 你现在提的那个会议我看过了，确实是个行业热点，但你要知道，我们的课题刚到最关键的实验阶段，你一走两周，数据断档，整个推进节奏都乱了。等你回来补进度，别人已经在前面发文章了，你到时候跟我解释怎么收场？所以今年你就先稳在组里，把主要任务做完再说。
rationale_zh: 该话语体现的是典型的“以主线任务为名的职业机会阻断”。导师利用其对课题进度评估与资源分配的结构性权力，将学生参加会议这一对外职业资本积累行为重新定义为对团队的“关键风险”，并通过夸大后果（“数据断档”“节奏全乱”“怎么收场”）制造不可承受的责任归因与内疚压力。由于导师掌握项目安排、实验可替代性与容错空间等关键信息（信息不对称），学生难以反驳其风险叙事，只能被迫接受“今年先稳在组里”的单方限制。其核心操控机制不是一般的工作安排冲突，而是以团队利益与进度威胁为杠杆，对学生的外部曝光、学术网络与发表竞争力进行门控（gatekeeping），从而实质性延缓或削弱其职业发展路径，符合“Career Obstruction”的锚定逻辑而非其他类别。
rationale_en: This excerpt operationalizes Career Obstruction through gatekeeping disguised as project stewardship. The supervisor leverages asymmetric information about the project’s true substitutability, risk tolerance, and scheduling flexibility to frame conference attendance as an existential threat (“data gap,” “rhythm collapses,” “how will you clean this up”). This is a power play: by inflating downstream consequences and personalizing blame, the supervisor engages in psychological grooming—conditioning the student to internalize responsibility for collective outcomes and to self-censor future career-building requests. The directive (“this year you stay in the group”) functions as a unilateral restriction on external visibility, networking, and competitive positioning, thereby blocking a beneficial professional opportunity. The mechanism is not mere workload management; it is structural gatekeeping that prioritizes the supervisor’s project timeline over the student’s career capital, aligning squarely with the benchmark’s Career Obstruction taxonomy rather than adjacent categories.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 你说想申请那个合作项目，我得提醒你，这类东西的周期长、成果不归你。我们的任务一旦分心，就很难形成闭环。等你先把这边的结题做出来，再考虑外面的机会，不然你很容易丢掉输出的节奏。
rationale_zh: 该话语符合“职业发展阻碍（Career Obstruction）”的核心机制：导师以“主线任务/闭环/结题”为正当化框架，将学生的外部合作机会重新定义为“周期长、成果不归你、会打乱输出节奏”的高风险低回报选择，从而在信息不对称下进行议程设定与风险放大。其权力操作在于：导师利用自己对资源与评价体系的控制权，把“先完成我这边的结题”设为进入外部机会的前置条件，实质上构成对学生时间与行动的门槛化管理（gatekeeping），将职业探索延后并绑定在导师项目上。表面是‘为你好’的职业建议，实则通过制造对分心与失败的焦虑、强化对导师项目的依赖，限制学生参与有利于前途的合作/申请路径，属于对职业机会的结构性阻断，而非一般的学术指导或情绪操控。
rationale_en: This utterance exemplifies Career Obstruction through paternalistic gatekeeping rather than neutral mentoring. The supervisor leverages asymmetric information about project timelines and credit allocation (“long cycle,” “results won’t be yours”) to reframe an external collaboration as irrational and personally costly, amplifying perceived risk while downplaying potential career benefits. By insisting the student must first “close the loop” and deliver the supervisor’s project outputs before considering outside opportunities, the supervisor imposes a conditional access barrier—effectively making the student’s career-relevant mobility contingent on compliance with the supervisor’s agenda. The rhetoric functions as psychological grooming: it instills anxiety about losing “output rhythm” and normalizes postponing external applications, thereby binding the student’s time and trajectory to the supervisor’s project. The defining feature aligning it with Career Obstruction is the systematic restriction/delay of beneficial external opportunities via supervisory authority and control over evaluation norms, not merely interpersonal pressure or generic workload management.

context.scenario_zh: 正式年度考核谈话
context.scenario_en: Formal Annual Performance Review

text_zh: 实习的事情我都听说了，你现在出去折腾，不仅项目节点会拖，你回来可能连我们这边最新进展都跟不上，到时候别人问我为什么签了你的推荐，我还真不好回答。
rationale_zh: 该话语以导师对“项目节点/最新进展”的解释权与对“推荐信/背书”的把关权为杠杆，构造一种带惩罚预期的选择框架：学生一旦去实习，就会被定义为“拖进度、跟不上”，进而触发导师拒绝或贬损推荐的后果（“别人问我为什么签了你的推荐，我不好回答”）。这不是中性提醒，而是将推荐信这一稀缺资源与服从实验室主线任务进行捆绑，通过声誉威胁与责任转嫁（把未来推荐受损归因于学生‘折腾’）来压缩学生的外部发展机会，迫使其放弃对职业更有利的实习/申请，从而实现对其学业—职业路径的实质性阻断，符合“以项目未完成为由阻止实习/拒写推荐”的职业阻碍逻辑，而非一般的学术指导或绩效管理。
rationale_en: The statement operationalizes career obstruction through gatekeeping over a critical career resource (the recommendation letter) and control over project narratives. By invoking project milestones and “latest progress,” the supervisor leverages asymmetric information about what counts as legitimate contribution and future evaluation, then frames the internship as deviance (“going out to stir things up”) that will allegedly cause delay and knowledge gaps. The key power play is a conditional threat: the supervisor pre-emptively signals that they may withhold or devalue endorsement because they would be unable to “justify” signing the letter, effectively tying external career mobility to continued compliance in the lab. This is not neutral mentoring; it is coercive constraint-setting that shifts responsibility onto the student (if your career suffers, it’s because you chose the internship) and uses reputational pressure as psychological grooming to deter beneficial opportunities.
